review_text: We had our wedding reception brunch of about 60 people in the Skyline Room at Seasons in the Park restaurant in early August of 2023, and we were blown away by the outstanding service at our wedding! The food was delicious, the portions were generous, and the restaurant was more than happy to accommodate a few of our guests who had dietary restrictions. The service was fast, and the communication with us was incredible. So many of our guests also complimented the excellent service they received during our reception, and we had so many compliments about the beautiful view of Vancouver as well. The servers even went out of their way to ensure that we, the bride and groom, were comfortable and well taken care of during the entire brunch. Even the preplanning was smooth and seamless, and communicating back and forth with Makda about wedding details was an easy process. Many of our guests have commented that this was one of the best weddings theyve been to, and we could not have done it without all the wonderful help provided by Seasons. As a wedding venue, we highly recommend Seasons in the Park! Plus, we felt compared to other wedding venues, that Seasons was quite reasonable, and who can beat that beautiful view of Vancouver, and wonderful setting within Queen Elizabeth Park. Thank you very much Seasons for making our special day so wonderful!

Pleasantly surprised at the quality and value-for-money here.  Got the 3 course lunch menu and left very satisfied. The steak was tender and flavorful.  The cake was quite substantial and rich.  The creme brulee had hints of citrus in it. The mushroom soup was lacking a bit tho.  A bit bland, had to add some more salt and pepper to it myself but couldnt really help it. Service was very good and the views are amazing on the patio.

Seasons in the Park gave my girlfriend and I an excellent dining experience for our date night. Neither of us had been here before and we were both very impressed with the views, food and the service. Our server was amazing and insisted to take photos of us during the sunset, which was such a nice touch to the experience. We will definitely be coming back here again in the future. I highly recommend anyone come here for dinner and try to get a table on the patio by the fire place, it was absolutely splendid.

Really great meal for both of us (prime rib for me, only available on Sunday suppers). Nice view looking over downtown Vancouver in the distance, and pretty quiet sitting outside. Wait staff was very nice. Did have a very minor issue that I wouldnt have been surprised if anyone as busy as they were at the time would make so they gave us a free (and very good) dessert to make up for it.

One of our dear family friends took me for dinner after a delicate painful sinus procedure I had to fly in from Kelowna. Its been decades since I have been there, what a beautiful stop to enjoy the view of Vancouver City. Great Service and delicious food. We enjoyed the days special grilled chard. We walked away with the sunshine in our pockets, the ultimate healing.

This was on my to go list for very long time and recently I got the chance to visit. I went for a lunch date and I was so not disappointed. Their charred Salmon with risotto is simply amazing   and ofcourse the views just make everything better. Patio seating is gorgeous but indoor seating is more fine Dine vibe. So you can choose according to what you feeling :)

Great views of the city. Very good food! The hostess was a bit grumpy and told us there was a 2 hour limit on our table when we arrived but our waitress Alma made up for it. Alma was friendly and offered amazing suggestions from the menu. Everyone in our group was extremely satisfied with our meals.

What a great experience. After living in Vancouver for 20 years and dines out many times. This is surely one of the gems. One of my best meals and service experiences in Vancouver. The atmosphere, maturity of the servers, comfort of seating, views and delicious meals make it one of the best for sure. Our server Matthew was perfect in every way, and spot on with recommendations. Sure made for a wonderful experience. His suggestion to have the pork chop was spot on and truly perfectly cooked and served. Absolutely delicious. And other meals just as good. Perfect flavours and presentation. All round service support was also fantastic. Will surely be back for Prime Rib Sunday! An absolutely great dinner and perfect for spoiling mom on Mother s Day.

Had a wonderful dinner one Sunday when it was Prime Rib day, and all 4 of us had the Special. We were seated at a perfect table with a great view to share with our nephew and partner visiting us from Denmark. The Caesar Salad was very good, fresh and lightly dressed and the Carpaccio was wonderful. The prime ribs were very good all around although mine needed a little more time on the grill for my liking but they accommodated me without fuss. We were too full for dessert so we just had Cuppacinos for all. It was a very enjoyable dinner and the service was great. Cant go wrong.

Incredible views! Food was delicious and the service was quick and professional. Highly recommend for a date night or party booking in one of their private rooms. Its a pricier dining experience but views and food make it worth that extra bit. Save time for photos outside in front of the city skyline!

This is a fabulous restaurant to visit on special occasion. The views are spectacular. The food was delicious. I got mussels with a side of truffle fries and was incredibly satisfied. Definitely romantic vibes - would make a good date night!

I came here with my family for lunch and we all got the fixed price lunch menu which was $55 pp. The food was very well made and the view of the park and city were beautiful! We got the crab arancini, truffle mushroom soup, duck confit, NY strip loin, chocolate cake, and vanilla creme brulee. I especially loved the duck as it was very tender and flavorful, and the creme brulee was light and not too sweet. We had a great time!

My husband frequents this when he has to take out people from work and he told me Id love it. So he took me here today and it was amazing. The area the restaurant is in looks welcoming and nice. When I walked into the restaurant, it was definitely a breathtaking experience. It felt like a fancy restaurant. The main thing about this restaurant is the views. As everyone has probably mentioned in all their reviews, but that scenery you get is astonishing. Your at the highest point in the city and as a reward, you get to see the mountains, Vancouver downtown, and all the greenery. The food was pretty good. We got the Lois Lake Steelhead Salmon, Wood Grill Chicken, and Lobster Tail. The service was good. The waiter was very nice and professional. The prices werent super expensive. They were quite reasonable and similar to other restaurants. I would definitely go back again and recommend.

Great restaurant to celebrate a birthday or anniversary. The pork chop and mac and cheese was legitimately delicious. The crab cakes appetizers were a little overpriced for the amount you get, but everything else was definitely worth it

Such a classy, elegant but yet unpretentious restaurant atop a clifftop hill with gorgeous views in the distance! After exploring the Bloedel Conservatory & Queen Elizabeth Park, my touristy group of eight (8) walked to the nearby Seasons in the Park restaurant for drinks & dinner. I enjoyed the Lois Lake Steelhead Salmon (grilled salmon glazed with lemon-caper butter sauce and served on a bed of coconut rice with asparagus & carrots). For dessert, the Raspberry Cheesecake was perfectly sweet and light. And our hardworking server, Bela, was professional and attentive. Afterwards, my group of eight raved about their meals and this memorable dining experience.

This a place that you should visit at least once if you are in the neighbourhood. At least in the summer the terrace is unbelievable with the sights and the surrounding gardens. Service was good and I had the best fish and chips here that I have ever eaten (until I visited Iceland later on, but that is a tough comparison). Not as expensive as we first thought with the location and all, well worth a lunch visit at least.

Took my husband for his birthday and was so happy that I did! Staff was lovely and attentive. Food was amazing and the view was gorgeous! Definitely recommend trying the truffle fries for the table! But everything served was enjoyed! With a nice cake surprise at the end. Thank you for making my husbands birthday extra special!

We had a lovely meal in celebration of our anniversary. Service was excellent (thank you very much Esther!) and we were offered a complimentary dessert to round it out. The setting was perfect, a beautiful day on the patio in what we considered the best seats in the house. Will definitely recommend and return.
Great staff! Beautiful views   and delicious food. We had the lunch pris fix menu. After lunch went for a stroll through the park.
Great atmosphere with a beautiful view of Queen Elizabeth Park and delicious food. They really made my dad s birthday special.
Birthday dinners.  Food was wonderful and our server was inevitable.  Very friendly and helpful as my pruner was in a wheel chair.  First time there with our boyfriend.

Located @Queen Elizabeth Park. The highest elevated in Vancouver with incredible view. Restaurant vibes a bit old but cozy, Foods are delicious, beautiful presentation, excellent service. They offer special beet salad, thats the best beet ever. Thank you very much for my free chocolate birthday cake.

Stunning view from the restaurant even it was rainy and foggy. Cozy but updated interior including washroom. Love classy formal table setting and amazing service with professional friendly servers. Variety food choices on the menu (they have today s specials not on the menu as well) and all we ordered were looking amazing and tasted great! No issue with the parking, so many spots and I paid $6 for 2 hours on family day. It s perfect place for special occasions like birthdays, anniversaries and friends unions etc.

Beautiful inside, amazing views! Very friendly and caring staff! The steak just melts in your mouth so delicious! I have never tasted such delicious cakes, moderately sweet just what I wanted. Will come back 100%

I ve lived in the neighbourhood near Seasons for 20 years. We ve always joked about how it s overpriced and mediocre. We ve dined here many times for celebrations, usually graduations. It s always been decent but again, a bit overpriced. We went for Saturday brunch today and it really surprised us! We just walked in around 11, they have tons of unreserved patio seating. We got a beautiful table overlooking the city. And when we saw the menu we realized the brunch prices are incredibly reasonable. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our food. Salmon burger was awesome. Smoked salmon benny was seasoned to perfection. Everything was hot. Then to top it all off our server brought a free cake out for my grandma s birthday. Absolutely amazing experience. Our server was so professional and warm without being overbearing. Plus she took some amazing photos of us! Thank you to the team at Seasons! We will be back and not only for celebrations because the brunch prices are so reasonable!
Great atmosphere and view. Very friendly staff and solid service. Food is also decent.
Insanely good food, the bartender and wait staff were so kind. Incredible atmosphere, it felt like a dream!

Seasons in the Park is a sleeper! Beautiful drive on the way up to the restaurant. Breathtaking views in the day and night. Valet parking available, and outside patio seating with a fireplace. Excellent service, and exquisite menu. Highly recommend the Seasons s mushroom caps and seafood linguine. We will be back!

Amazing panoramic view of downtown while sitting in the restaurant. it s situation at highest point of Queen Elizabeth Park enhances it s beauty/environment. Incomparable attitude/behaviour of staff & freshness of freshly Cooked food adds another feather in it s cap. Worth visiting at least once, further u will b attracted magically.Must a try.
amazing place for any special occasion. great food options with fantastic view of the garden and mountain afar.
Celebrated my partner s birthday here and the service was impeccable as was the food.
Amazing views, delicious food and amazing staff service! Marek was specially attentive and was overall a great time; we ll be coming back.
The best ever food !!! The view is amazing All the servers come check on us.Erika was great  serving us !!we are still here Food

It was a fabulous night out with friends. The view of the city harbor and distant mountains was worth every dime. Everyone had different dishes and gave lots of praises. I had Arctic Char which was fresh but perhaps a little strange to my taste but overall a fantastic experience. The service was just so wonderful.
Really good food, we did Dine out Vancouver, and the menu was amazing. Lamb shank and surf and turf were both amazing, and the creme brulee was a perfect way to end the meal. Amazing views as well.
Excellent dining locale - right in the heart of Queen Elizabeth Park. Wonderful views, service is great, the food is very good.

Seasons in the Park is a fine dining experience. The location at  Queen Elizabeth Park is exquisite from the moment you walk in the door we were greeted politely, not over the top. We had a choice of outside or inside we chose outside but being  a bit chilly we were able to move inside with no hesitation from the staff. The menus are not complicated but refined with excellent selection. We each had one their select cocktails Spicy Mango and New York Sour then crab cake to share. We ordered the lamb and halibut. We like to share so again no hesitation as they brought us extra plates   The two dishes complimented each other nicely. Our server helped in a wine selection and brought us a dessert for our special occasion. Overall great location, wonderful service and good food Parking: Metered parking

The views at night were breath taking. You are removed from the city enough that it almost feels like a destination. Stunning old charm, great food and the best staff. Wonderful memories will be made here.

Had a wonderful time!! Our service was fantastic from Karthik. The food was delicious, we had the French toast (came with bacon!) and the salmon Benedict (the potato latke was a good touch). Coffee was also excellent. Rainy day but the outside patio was still plenty warm and great views.

My experience of dining at Seasons in the Park was a remarkably wonderful experience. When I called in to make a reservation I spoke to Richard Baker the General Manager.  I shared that there would be six people dining and we would be celebrating a birthday. Upon arriving, I was delighted to learn that we had been given Table 6, a particularly sought after table that has a spectacular view of the city and nature. The six of us happily wined and dined. The service at Seasons was excellent. The staff were professional; attentive to our needs and very polite. The food simply could not have been more delicious. The dining experience was a 10/10.  I am most grateful for all that the staff did to make our celebration one to remember. Thank you Seasons!  Victoria Campbell

Wow! I took my partner for his 40th birthday last night. I knew I couldnt request a window or patio specifically as its first come first serve, but I asked anyways in my reservation online in the notes. Just in case. We were greeted at the front with both hostesses saying happy birthday to him, and they put us in the most beautiful spot imaginable! With the most gorgeous view! I mean honestly all spots in there are amazing with views but ours was the best I think! We had absolutely wonderful service from Peter who was funny and very professional. And the food and wine was outstanding! I highly recommend this place for any occasion. And will absolutely come back! Also it was funny because every table in there seemed to be celebrating birthdays so its definitely a special spot that people take loved ones, and I see why! Thank you Peter and thank you everyone at Seasons!

Bring your elegant attire and happy attitude. This is a spectacular place to take someone out on a date or a special night. One of the top restaurants with an outbidding view in Vancouver. The sweeping panorama of Vancouver s mountains from the restaurant is undoubtedly splendid and awe-inspiring. The breathtaking view will force you to get a seat on the patio. I guarantee you will be blown away by what you will see! Besides that, The food was mouthwatering and was cooked to perfection, also the service was timely. We will come back again and again
Excellent food and service. Dinner for two, appie entree and coffee drink. $150.00 plus tip

Great food, excellent service and incredible presentation. The dishes had amazing flavour - just the right amount of salt. I didn t manage to take a photo of the appetizer (mushrooms), as the table grabbed to take a bit too quickly! If there is anything I d recommend is for sure get 2 portions of those mushrooms! Absolutely my favorite appetizer on their menu.

If youre looking for a place to celebrate birthday or anniversary. This place is good for that. The food here are delicious. Im giving       for the food, for the view for the friendly and knowledgeable staff for the restaurant settings and cleanliness. Everything is expensive now but you wont even notice the price after you finished your meal here.

My family were in Vancouver on vacation and did the Sunday brunch @ Seasons. All of the staff was exceptional with service working so well as a team to make sure for a great experience. Our primary waiter was Marek, he was fantastic! We enjoyed his friendly personality, helpfulness, and touring attraction suggestions. We went on his suggestions and were not disappointed. He spent a great bit of attention to us but was not over bearing by any means. The atmosphere and views were perfect. I highly recommend this is must go to restaurant on your visit to Vancouver.

I held a significant event for my referral partners, which was terrific. The food was fantastic, the staff was accommodating, and the atmosphere and view were stellar. Thank you to all the staff at Seasons; you are genuinely first-class.

The server and food were great! The waitress was very knowledgeable about the food and very friendly! She helped us take a group photo (celebrating my birthday), and checked in on us regularly! The view is beautiful as well! Would definitely be coming back!
great lunch and view. the service is also good.

We reserved the whole downstairs of the restaurant. It was a bit dark, but the view was pretty good. Food and service was good. We had a set menu since it was a party. Mushroom soup, crab cake, lobster and prawns, and creme burlee for dessert. Had a good time.
Food is decent. Truffle fries were spectacular. Our server Marek was fun, delightful and super attentive. Ask for him when you dine in the restaurant.

The view is beautiful! I was amazed by the level of service and the food was exceptional. Would highly recommend for a nice night out. My group had the chicken, seafood pasta, gnocchi, duck, and the mushroom pasta. We all loved our food. The main server was very knowledgeable on the wine list and we felt very taken care of. Once we got our meals our conversation was never interrupted but the servers were able to recognize when to fill our glasses or clear the table. This was much appreciated.
Five stars all around! We loved the view, the Christmas decorations were lovely, great food and service. A lovely night out to celebrate our anniversary.

5 stars all around for Seasons in the Park. My family of 15 dined for my parents  50th wedding anniversary. We had an amazing view of the city from our table. Mark Tay, our server, provided the best service and was very friendly and attentive. The food was high quality and very well priced. We had mussels, truffle fries, squid and prawns, duck confit, pork chops, halibut, spaghetti, seafood carbonara, rack of lamb, steelhead salmon and chicken fingers for the kids. Presentation and portion sizes were great! Everyone enjoyed their food. We d definitely come here again! Thanks again Mark! Tip for future diners: to ensure you enjoy your dinner without stressing out about being ticketed for expired parking in the Easy Park lot, make sure you pay for more than enough time, or even better, do valet parking at the restaurant. The Easy Park attendant was making his rounds and ticketing several cars.

Best view of the city !! The restaurant is stunning. It s upscale and fine dine. Sunsets are the best time to visit this place. In case of food, I had a salad which was good but not great, variety of sea food is huge but since I m a vegetarian, I had to settle at salad. I would recommend this place more for the view than the space, make sure you sit at the patio

Today is our first time sitting at their patio, what a gorgeous view! Great service and food. Alana was friendly and always replenish our hot water (which we truly appreciate). I had their seafood carbonara and grilled halibut today. Usually, I enjoy their steak and sablefish. Chocolate cake is always rich and creamy.

Delicious food, wonderful service, but most of all- incredible views! Try to be there before sunset to get the full experience. I had the Ahi appetizer, Sablefish dinner, and Lemmon tart dessert and all were wonderful
Exquisite. Fine dining and fabulous views. Adequate heat outside and a friendly staff.

I had really nice experience in this restaurant. My boyfriend booked for anniversary dinner and staffs were already aware what we were here for. They celebrated for us together. Food are great, staffs are nice, view is pretty! I highly recommend this restaurant if youre looking for awesome experience for your anniversary.
What a view! The food was superb, and the wait staff were phenomenal. What a great experience.
Karthik is an excellent serving host. Celebrated an event and he was very professional. I am bringing my friends for the outstanding view and great food choices.

So amazing! The food was absolutely delicious. Pricey, but you pay for the incredibly fresh ingredients. Youd think the serving size would be small, but it was just perfect still. I feel so full! Theres paid parking on the roadside. $8 for 2 hours. Or $12 valet.
Attentive service and quality food. Especially enjoyed the truffle fries and sablefish with coconut rice.

Amazing panoramic view of downtown while sitting in the restaurant. it s situation at highest point of Queen Elizabeth Park enhances it s beauty/environment. Incomparable attitude/behaviour of staff & freshness of freshly Cooked food adds another feather in it s cap. Worth visiting at least once, further u will b attracted magically

We really like this place. Especially the view. Five stars that they allowed us to sit outside even if we did t have a full dinner. Appetizers menu is small , not much to choose, but it s ok. Everything there is nice and tasty (but pricey). Service is fast. We found something in our dessert, chef recognized the pile from a brush for spreading the yolk - we received apologies and restaurant didn t change us for that dessert. Lovely place. Wanna go again. With a full dinner.

We stumbled upon this restaurant while at the park. We went in and asked if they could accommodate our sons nut allergies and they said absolutely. Restaurant is gorgeous. We sat in Philips section. He was amazing. Food was great for lunch. Views were beautiful. And our son enjoyed his allergy spaghetti. We all left happy!

Went there for the beautiful view on New Year s Day. I would say although this restaurant is mostly famous for its location and scenery, the taste is not bad, at least compared to other pubs with identical sceneries.

My girlfriend and I came in for our anniversary, and this was our first time visiting the restaurant. Upon entry, atmosphere was great, music was great, seating experience was great. James was our server for the night, and my girlfriend and I both having previous serving experience immediately could tell James was a professional at what he does. He made us feel very welcome, and kept the night very light hearted and pleasant. We recommend visiting this restaurant, and coming in just to see James. We will be back.

Came here for a retirement party that was booked in a private room. The service was great, everything served at good timing. The food was cooked perfectly and dessert was so delicious. All the flavors were excellent with perfect portion sizing.

We went there on the thanksgiving day. I have to day that it was a really great restaurant with the great staffs. First for the food the staffs gave a really good recommendations for that. My favorite was appetizer  Mussels provencal  that was so delicious good for starter and we even need focaccia to have them with the leftovers broth underneath. And they gave us the balcony seat so the view is nice for the good thanksgiving dinner

One of the best experiences of having supper in the lap of nature. The restaurant is lovely itself, set in the picturesque setting overlooking the beautiful Vancouver skyline. I visited Seasons in the Park for late lunch last week, and we had white wine sangria - one of the best and refreshing ones yet! The fries were a lovely start for the meal and the mushroom truffle entree was a delicate dance of various taste buds for me! I thoroughly enjoyed the meal and topped it with a slice of lemon cheesecake. It was so beautiful even during the day, that I cannot wait to visit again for dinner. Highly recommend!

One of the best views in the city. Sitting on top of Queen Elizabeth Park. Valet parking is $12 while parking along the road for 2 hours is $7.50. The restaurant is beautiful with multiple rooms and gorgeous views of the city. Ask for patio seating on a nice day and make sure it s the back patio not the front. No view from the front patio. Food and service is really good. I would stay away from the Caesar salad. The brussel sprouts and macaroni and Cheese were amazing.

Awesome view. Service was sharp. Food was on point with quality and flavor. Great wine selection especially their Pinot. Great for large parties. If you want it medium, theyll cook it medium. Likewise for rare meat. Seafood was fresh and the tomato soup base was rich.

My sister just had her wedding her and it was absolutely perfect from the food, service and atmosphere. Kudos to Peter our head waiter, he made sure that everything will went smoothly and taken care of. Thank you also to Quentin and the F&B Coordinator, Makda. I highly recommend this place.

My first time here. Service was great! Lamb and duck perfectly cooked. Theres lots of seafood on the menu so be aware of that if youre not a fan. Drinks are the same as at the rest of this groups establishments. Parking in the park is a bit expensive.

That VIEW! I knew there was a reason I moved to Vancouver. Seasons in the park just confirmed that. Food was great, service was impeccable, cannot for the life of me remember the server s name, but he was a lovely, friendly, energetic asian man. We got a seat on the patio, and we weren t by the edge but were perfectly content nonetheless, but our server saw another table open up and helped us get a better seat. He found out it was my birthday, and when we told him we weren t interested in dessert, he looked dejected and said,  Please let me at least get you a little piece of cake!  Which I thought was hilarious. I agreed, and it was delicious. Great dinner for my birthday!

Pleasantly surprising long time institution serving tasty West Coast cuisine.  Downtown quality food at Queen Elizabeth park.  Checks all the boxes for a nice night out without the chaos and pretension of being downtown.  Id recommend.  Sablefish was perfect.

Wonderful atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, and gorgeous views. Food selection is excellent as well, with daily offerings spicing things up! We were lucky to get the dungeness crab cake which was amazing. We will definitely be returning and recommending Seasons to our friends and family. Parking: Ample parking is only a few steps away and does not break the bank. If youre feeling fancy, valet service is also available at Seasons.

We organized a 100 year birthday in the Summit Room at Seasons in the Park (43 guests), and highly recommend it! We were fortunate to have Makda assist us with the organization. She was amazing. She anticipated our needs and her suggestions were perfect for our event. The service was handled by Peter and Andre, who did an amazing job with the set up and drink / food service - Thank you! The Summit room has a separate entrance and that worked in our favour as guests could gather outside at the entrance without impacting the main restaurant. Family from all over the world have viewed the photos and videos and all agree, the venue was fantastic for this event. Thank you to Seasons in the Park, Makda, Peter, Andre, and all the back of the house staff that made this 100 year birthday event so memorable for our Mom, ourselves, and our guests. Vegetarian options: Good vegetarian options. Kid-friendliness: Good options for children. Wheelchair accessibility: Wheeled right into the Summit room.

We were a party of five, three of us old friends celebrating birthdays that are within two weeks of each other.  We dont often get together so its a big deal when we do.  The table was perfect, with a great view of the city.  The server was James, who quickly understood why we were there.  The food, the drinks, the wine, were all excellent.  In short it was one of the best restaurant experiences Ive ever had.  And I want to thank James again for all that he did to make it so.

Seasons in the Park, A Must-go restaurant in BC! You can be there sooner than your reservation to roam around the beautiful Queen Elizabeth Park. I recommend you be here for both lunch & dinner. The scenery and view is unique here and the restaurant resides on top of a hill above the park. The view is astonishing in both nigh and day. Food suggestions: In the Seasons In the Park, you have to drink some wine with its perfect vibe especially at night. BURROWING OWL CABERNET (BC) is a good option. All the steaks are well prepared and served exactly as you order. The Rib Steak & the Grass Fed Tenderloin are nice options. Fraser Valley Chicken is also delicious if you are into the chicken. You have nice options for the dessert. VANILLA CREME BRULEE & New York Cheesecake are both must-tries. There is Valet Parking on the premise. Enjoy!

I have been coming here for decades.  It is an ideal venue for a celebration, a romantic night out or a solo treat.  Best view in the city even on a cloudy day in winter.  Cozy up to the fire place, kick back and enjoy a drink and nosh. I highly recommed the duck.  Their sister restaurants dont have it and its super yum! But be prepared to drop $60/person.

We had a fantastic dining experience at Seasons in the Park. We came on a Monday night, which was a quiet night to come. We had lovely window seats with a gorgeous view of the city. Their wine menu has a good variety and lots of affordable options. We ordered the brussel sprouts and crab and shrimp mushrooms to start. The brussel sprouts were crispy, a touch citrusy, and delicious. The mushrooms were really creamy, but we didnt notice the crab or shrimp flavours very much. For our mains, we ordered the duck confit and the lamb shank. Both mains were fantastic. My favourite was the lamb, it was perfectly cooked and had a delicious, rich sauce. Because we came to celebrate a birthday, they gave us a complimentary slice of chocolate cake. We also ordered the creme brulee. Overall, a great experience here and would highly recommend for a romantic night out.

I had my wedding dinner here with our immediate family, so there were 8 of us. We sat at a nice round table. The view is great from all the tables! Everyone was pleased with their meals, and the servers worked hard and were friendly! Gianfranco made sure I had water for my bouquet, and he was so helpful!

Came back here again for my mom s birthday. It was our first time dining for lunch instead of dinner. The menu consisted of appies, soups, salad, burgers and pasta. We ordered Humboldt Squid and Prawn ($19.50), Clam Chowder ($13), Salmon Burger ($20.50), Cod and Chips ($24.50), Seafood Linguine Carbonara ($33.50), with Lobster Tail ($23). Everything was good. Clam Chowder had a tomato flavour while I expected a typical creamy clam chowder. Bread was good as well. I was glad having a refill to share with my family. Our server Esther gave attentive service and offered free dessert for my mom. She did a wonderful job serving us and interacting in Korean. We had our water refilled often. It was a quite memorable experience for my family we ll be back again.
Friendly and experienced staff, great appetizers and sides.  Pork chop lightly overcook but still good!
Amazing food ,Excellent taste & attitude of staff. Beautiful ambience of Queen Elizabeth Park makes it a perfect place for a formal dinners.

The view and atmosphere here was absolutely incredible! We came here for my boyfriends birthday and our server went above and beyond. He asked us if we were dining in for a special occasion, offered to take photos of us, and gave my boyfriend and additional piece of chocolate cake to celebrate his birthday. The prime rib special on Sunday is a must try, and very filling. I was extremely happy with everything, from the price of the three course meal, to the kind and accommodating server!

We, as a family, go to Seasons throughout the year and are always so impressed with the service. We always ask to be seated in Marek s section, because he is so attentive, caring and thoughtful. Top notch service and great food. Thanks, Seasons, and thanks, Marek, for providing excellent service to us for so many years. Joy

Seasons in the Park - revisited: We visited the Seasons for the umpteenth times, which on this occasion, we had a light lunch.  The Salmon and the QE burgers were truly delightful and quite filling.  For a quick and impromptu meal, we sat at the bar this time because we didnt want to wait for a table (reservation is highly recommended for lunch).  The view was spectacular and the service was outstanding. A solid 5 stars all around, as always. -- Seasons is by far is one of our most favourite restaurants, particularly on special occasions.  When we have guests from out-of-town, it is a restaurant that guarantees exceptional food and service, spectacular view of the city, and after lunch or dinner, a nice walk along the paths of QE Park.

What an incredible place to come for Lunch...we tried for Valentines Day 2022! Food was fresh.. prepared perfectly..our waiter Peter was super friendly and excellent to deal with! Will be back sooner than later

An absolutely amazing place to dine. The view was amazing, the food to die for and service impeccable!! I took my kids there to celebrate them graduating. Merak our server made it extra special. Highly recommend eating here.

My parents were visiting from LA and we really enjoyed our experience here. We made a reservation for 11:45 am and were quickly seated by the windows with an incredible view looking out towards Downtown Vancouver. All of us ordered the 3 course lunch menu and had an amazing meal. A special shoutout to our server, Marek, who was so welcoming and friendly. We would definitely recommend coming to Seasons.

Fantastic Views!! Had a breathtaking view on the patio. Great social distancing and Covid protocols. Friendly quick service. Food is always delicious. Mussels were plump and flavorful.  Lemon pie always yummy. Seasons in the Park  Never dissappoints. One of the best views of Vancouver.

Seasons in the park is nothing short of a culinary delight. The Tastefully appointed decor is exceptional. The waiters and waitresses are at the top of their game very helpful and really add to the pizzazz of this establishment. The food is amazing the bathrooms are clean they have sweeping views of the city an interesting bit of trivia is Bill Clinton and Boris Yeltsin had a summit dinner and they post their blue plate meal and menu they served has a memorability on the wall including a picture of Bill himself.

Excellent place to have a dinner with your family or friends with an amazing service and a stunning view! Yesterday me and my friends had a dinner at Seasons in the Park and we absolutely love it! Wanted to mention the servers Mauricio and Bela S. amazing customer service, they was always there when we had questions, they also described and told us more about the restaurant and what is the best to see in the park! Thanks to this guys they made our evening!!!
Marek made our experience fantastic! He was so friendly and welcoming ! Very at tentative and sat us at a nice seat with a view. Thanks Marek!

I never write reviews but felt the need to write one about our wonderful service by Esther yesterday. She was lovely, extremely professional and went above and beyond. In addition, she thought our pasta took too long to come out and without us saying anything, she gave us our pasta as well as a dessert for free. Totally unnecessary but very appreciated. My fiance and I also took a quick look around after as we are considering having our engagement party at seasons and Peter as well as his coworker who were cleaning up the sky line room after a baby shower talked to us. Both very helpful, funny and kind. Our experience with your staff solidified that we are going to choose Seasons for our party :) thank you so much!

Been here a few times for occasions, this time for our anniversary, food is great,  Marek the waiter was very good, he told us about other vegetarian options that wernt on the menu and one of the pastas we loved before he got for us, so we got that, got the mushroom ravioli on menu, great taste but portion could be a little bigger, he also suggested a Thai cauliflower dish with rice, was very good as well, however would be even better with mixed vegetables. Also love that this restaurant is one of the few left that gives free bread. Also a free dessert for occasion, little things like that make you keep coming back. Hopefully be back again soon. Beautiful view is what brought us here. And got engaged at the park.

This caesar salad changed my life! For a $11.50 you can experience three carefully selected leafy greens. Uncut, crunchy and carefully sauced. Your challenge begins in how one should eat this well looking over at the beautiful darkened skyline and looking down at this well presented piece of art. It makes other salads jealous and represents a masterpiece of creativity that gets me excited about the next dishes to come.

This place is a gem and so are the hosts. Rehana, our server, was amazing, and her colleague (Im kicking myself for not getting his name) was just as great. The food was delicious - we had their specialty dish - Namak Mandi, and the atmosphere was cozy - the kind of place where you instantly feel at home. Cant wait to go back and enjoy another wonderful meal with such friendly and attentive staff.

Visiting from California looking for a great meal. Had a very lovely dinner at this amazing restaurant! From food to service everything was top notch. I wasnt expecting authentic Pakistani flavors but everything we ordered was perfect and took me straight back home! The Chicken Lahori Karahi was made to perfection with the right level of spice and curry sauce. Would like to thank our waiter Awais for recommending us and giving us a delightful evening with a great chat. Would definitely come here again if ever visiting Vancouver!

Came from Edmonton to have some awesome Pakistani food. Expectations were MORE than met! Service was unreal and they treated us like true guests . Would come here every weekend if we could! Thanks to the team: especially Rihaana.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Somayya Kiani thank you for your feedback we really appreciate your business you re very welcome when ever you visit Vancouver we would love to serve you guys thank you

review_text: As someone who has always been fascinated by the rich culture and diverse cuisines of the world, I was thrilled to discover Karakoram Restaurant in Vancouver. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm hospitality and an inviting atmosphere that made me feel right at home. The decor is stylish and modern, with elegant lighting and comfortable seating. The menu features an impressive range of dishes from across the region, and the food is simply outstanding. Each dish is expertly crafted using only the freshest ingredients, and the flavours are vibrant and authentic. One of my favourite dishes is the Chicken Biryani, which is a fragrant and savoury rice dish that is seasoned with a blend of spices and herbs, and layered with succulent pieces of chicken. The lamb kebab is another must-try, with tender chunks of meat that are marinated in a delicious blend of spices and grilled to perfection. But what really sets Karakoram Restaurant apart is the exceptional service. The staff are friendly, attentive, and always willing to go above and beyond to ensure that their guests have a wonderful experience. From making recommendations to accommodating special requests, they truly go the extra mile. Whether youre a fan of Pakistani cuisine or simply looking for a unique and delicious dining experience, Karakoram Restaurant is an absolute must-visit. I cant recommend this place enough, and I look forward to my next visit!

The karahi is their signature dish and it s good! The people are very nice and helpful, ask for recommendations before you order (unlike what I did oops). I ll be back to try more flavors of karahi, and I ll bring friends.
The Karahi in Karakoram is another level. I also like  the haleem, it wasn t good before but now the recipe changed ig. I like the new taste better.

Delicious food, had the Karahi lamb, fresh naan, beef biryani (found out its half price on Wednesday) and lamb chops. Everything was spiced amazing, flavor was perfect, meat was halal and so tender. Service was good but they missed the fish pakora we ordered so never tried it. Had the Gulab Jamun w/ ice cream for dessert, and the falooda, both really good and decently unique
Had a spiritual experience with the chicken biryani. The karahi and kebab are excellent too. Highly recommend. I m no connoisseur but I feel confident in stating that this place is authentic.

We came in for a late lunch at about 3.45 pm and the restaurant was closed. But, the owner was kind enough to let us in and order whatever we d like from the menu. That s what customer service is. The owner gave us suggestions and made sure we were doing fine. The food is absolutely fantastic with delicate spices. The Special Karahi is stunning. I d like to thank the owner and staff for their amazing food and service, and also serving us while we came in early.

We drove from Seattle to Canada for dinner in Karakoram. It was an amazing experience, superb delicious food , great ambiance. Excellent customer service. Accommodated us despite big ongoing event in the restaurant. We recommend to try  mutton biryani , chicken seekh Kabab, beef Nihari, goat namak mandi karahi. Thank you to karakoram for complimentary dessert and Kashmiri tea. The Best restaurant in Vancouver/surrey. Must must try.

We are visiting Vancouver from Regina, Saskatchewan. We wanted to try pakistani restaurant and ended up at Karokoram Restaurant. I dont know any other pakistani restaurant in Vancouver but I can say surely that Karakoram has the real and authentic pakistani foods. we were not sure what to order so we asked their staff (Ayesha) for her suggestions for about 5 people. She recommended BBQ platter and every dish that included in the platter was so delicious and yummy, especially chicken karahi and chicken biryani. For dessert, we tried falooda and gajar ka halwa. Both were incredibly tasty. We would love to go again to try their foods. I highly recommend karakoram restaurant for those who are looking for real taste of pakistani foods. Parking: I believe street parking

Great food   we tried chicken karhai, biryani, nihari and haleem for main course and everything was authentic and delicious They have a very extensive menu and cordial service: desserts were very good too. Highly recommended !!
Lamb Lahori karahi with garlic naan is just out of the world!! We ordered their biggest platter and each of the items was super delicious    Highly recommend ..

The owner is a great guy! I visited this place with a friend and the owner personally dropped by our table to check in about our experience. We had a great conversation with him and he seemed to really know about the subtle nuances of what it takes to cook a really tasty meal. The Chicken Karahi here is by far the best I have ever had. We tried various kinds of breads with the Karahi and they all tasted amazing. I really recommend this place to anyone who s visiting Vancouver and is looking for a good desi meal!

Stopped by Karakoram for some lunch and wasn t disappointed! I drove out from Washington just for this authentic and delicious Pakistani food. With more than enough to choose from on the menu, I had a hard time to decide what to order! The Palak Paneer was delicious, I used the naan to wipe off every last bit out of the bowl. The Karahi was everything you could want and tasted so fresh. Nothing was too spicy and I left with a very satisfied and full stomach. Already planning the next trip just to come back for more delicious food.

Our time in the restaurant, yesterday evening, Oct 21st, was a real delight, a moment to memorable, thanks to delicious, warm, tasty food. However, what takes the gold medal for us was the service we received from the team of waitresses present. What a tremendous group of caring, attentive, entertaining and smiling workers! Special mention to Rehana, whose friendly and professional ways to interact with us represent a rare commodity!  Good job team!

As a customer of Karakoram heres a review for the restaurant staff&best waitress service, specifically mentioning Waitress  Manjot Kaur I had a fantastic dining experience at this restaurant, thanks in large part to the exceptional service provided by Waitress. their attentiveness, warm demeanor, and thorough knowledge of the menu truly enhanced our meal. Manjot went above and beyond to ensure we had a memorable evening. Her recommendations were spot-on, and she was always there when we needed anything. I cant thank her enough for making our visit so enjoyable. I highly recommend this restaurant and especially commend Waitress Manjot Kaur for her outstanding service. Thumbs up for the team Karakoram! Thanks,

We came from Calgary and reached here late night. Our experience was great! Food was amazing! Restaurant was nicely dimmedly lit with very calm and soothing atmosphere. Our server Manjot Parmar went above and beyond her duties to accomodate all our needs. We had an unusual request of getting a paper printed and Manjot didnt bat an eye and quickly fulfilled our request. Will 100% recommend to all of our friends and family. 5/5

My boyfriend and I went for dinner. We had the vegetable samosa, fish pakora and butter chicken with garlic naan and rice. The samosa was delicious. The sweet edge mixed well with the chutney. The fish pakora was fresh and crispy. The butter chicken was so creamy and was excellent with the naan. We liked that the naan was hot, not too thick and drenched in garlic. The server was really kind and prompt. We loved our experience here.

Amazing taste and phenomenal experience. Will visit them again next time in Vancouver. Staff is super helpful recommending what to eat and service is excellent. Don t forget to leave your jacket in the car else food smell will stay in it for a while.

Great first time Pakistan food experience! Everything was tasty and full of flavors. Love the meat plate, very juicy and tender. Will definitely visit again! Vegetarian options: A wide variety of vegetarian options from appetizers to main dishes.

We tried the food and it was delicious. Try out chicken karahi and nehari. And don t forget to order lamb biryani. The staff is very helpful and respectful. Rehana ma am, thanks for everything. Will come here again.
We had a great experience! Server, Manjot Parmar is great at what she does and goes above her duties to help the customers. Thank you for the amazing food and service! 5/5

After reading a few reviews on here we gave this restaurant a try on a weekday and this is what we Liked: Temperatur check, hand sanitizing and customer tracking at the door. Food was great, tasted amazing well prepped and defiantly authentic Pakistani style. Service was okay and I only say okay because it was pretty busy but only two waitresses were on shift. Floors need to be taken care of while leaving we noticed they were very slippery. Will still give them all 5 stars since the food was amazing.
response_from_owner_text: Hi S D thank you for your detail feedback we are happy that you liked our food we have cleaning company i will pass your comment about floor to them and make sure it is up to the standard looking forward to serve you again Team K-2

review_text: The quality and taste of their Chicken and Mutton is authentic and different. I would highly recommend those who really want to taste the best chicken in town. Specially their Balti chicken, Handi Chicken and Biryani s. Delicious food, had the Karahi lamb, fresh naan, beef biryani and lamb chops. Everything was spiced amazing, flavor was perfect, meat was tender. Service was great fish pakora we ordered so never tried it. Had the Gulab Jamun with Mango fruit cocktail and the falooda, both really good and decently cool.

Everything was amazing! Halal all the way! Very comfortable ambiance and a reasonable choice of desi items on the menu. Excellent service by the staff, really hardworking and solution oriented. I wish the quantity of their platters could be wholesome, but the taste is definitely great! My go to desi food place is sorted finally.
Some of the best chai I have had. Amazing karahi dishes.. they are known for them so def get them.. fresh rasmalai as well !!! Truly amazing. One was lamb karahi one was chicken karahi

Ive been walking by this place for months and always saw it was full so I was curious to try it out. Went last night and the food was delicious! Super fresh and tasty. Staff was very welcoming and nice, highly recommend to anyone!
It was my first experience with pakistanais Food Everything good the service the stuff very delicious meal and also Halal , highly recommend

Tried a few dishes here like paneer and biryani but the most memorable dish is their Karahi chicken which I recently ordered and brought to a dinner party. Needless to say it was a HIT! Karahi chicken is my absolute favourite chicken dish and I could eat it daily and Karakoram makes the best version I ve had here in Vancouver.
The food is so good, proper authentic Pakistani food. Make sure you have a reservation otherwise the wait is quite long, especially on a weekend!

Delicious food, wonderful ambiance and good service! Id like to give special commendations to one server in particular! I believe her name is Jol shes a lovely filipino lady and was very helpful and welcoming while we were there, she definitely deserves a raise! Please extend my gratitude to her :)

Well, you must enjoy Pakistani food here. Best is Karahi dishes, Tikka, Kabab, Fresh Naan, Pakistani Tea, vegetables dishes and more delicious dishes. You can order medium and hot spicy food, good and quick service. All server are friendly, knowledgeable about dishes, happy to help and answer you. They use  #HALAL meats. Few free parking, wheelchair accessible, 60-plus seating for dinner, and  online food order & and delivery option. Vegetarian options: Best and delicious vegetable dishes, fresh Noon, Tea. Parking: Few free parking and lots of other parking about few minutes walk. Kid-friendliness: Yes Wheelchair accessibility: Yes
First time here and we loved it! The food speaks for itself. The servers and chef came to our table. Arpita and Kushnam were very nice.

Best desi restaurant in Surrey. We only go to Surrey from Seattle to eat here. I recommend the restaurant to many of my co-workers with the confidence that their trip from Seattle will be great after eating scrumptious food here.

Can t tell you how amazing this place is!! The food is fresh, so delicious! Open at great hours, but best of all they are the most friendly caring service. Highly recommend. My wife and I will always be back!

Coming all the way from Seattle, Karakoram is a great Pakistani dining experience. Food is excellent and on a level I personally have not had before. Service is even better and the vibes inside the restaurant are unlike any other. My family and I have been to Karakoram many times and every single time we come the food and the dining experience is top notch. Would highly recommend

Ratings Scale 0 - 10 Variety: 8 Service or Product: 9 Customer Service: 9 Environment: 7 Cleaning: 6 Washroom: 2 Cost: 5 This was hands down the best Pakistani food Ive had in metro Vancouver over the past 2 years! The chicken karahi was a killer and the K2 platter which was a mix of beef and lamb kababs, chicken tikka boti and lamb boti was excellent as well! Naan, which I usually find to be weak areas for many restaurants here, were fresh, good sized and tasted great! When it came to the food, nothing disappointed, except maybe the vegetable pakoras. When good in taste and quantity, they were extremely extremely oily, which according to my wife happens when you dont let the oil heat enough before cooking. As for customer service by Pruthvi and Shadab, it was great, even if the wait time for food was quite long (~30 mins). They likely need more staff on weekend nights when it gets a little more busy than usual. Some areas for improvement that can further boost customer experience are: cleanliness, especially in the bathrooms. They were dirty and stank. Thats not good. Secondly, the ambiance needs a bit of work. It was a little dark. When it comes to dining, I prefer bright environments. However the food was so good, I could not deduct any points for this and still rate the overall experience as 5 stars! P.S the food is a little on the expensive side. It cost us around $35/head... Would visit more often if it was more economical.

I Used to visit this restaurant with friends. They were good before, there chicken Karahi chicken and karahi paneer was good and even naan. But ordered this week for take out. But it was not good experience, I even called the store back to notify them about naan s. The naan s I got with the dish was like from market of grocery store. There were bit heavy like breaded naan,they we re not cooked in store but the staff told they always cooked naan at the restaurant. I do not this so anything was taking in consideration, I did not even got a call back. Anyways when I went with my friends before we always got nice crispy and fresh naan. It s not a bad restaurant to visit one time. But as per there price is concern and quantity, you will definitely get double the quantity of food in that same price from other different restaurant. That was huge difference. Like there menu for example karahi paneer they charge 33$ with 2 naans . If you to different restaurant you get same quantity of karahi paneer for 17 or 18$
Good place to dine, came with friends and their dishes are marvelous. Will come with my cousin, for sure she will love this place as I did.

One of the best restaurant in town if you wanna try genuine Pakistani continental food....so much varieties especially in karahi, and each one of those has its own amazing taste. Staff is really friendly. Its an amazing place to have a nice family dinner with your taste of choice.

I always heard of Karakoram as a good Karahi whenever asked my peers but never really tried it. Finally today I was able to go there for dinner, I ordered Tandoori chicken and chicken Karahi. Their Karahi is so delicious and probably the best Karahi I have ever had in Vancouver. Tandoori chicken was good too. I also ordered chai afterwards and chai has that Elaichi touch in it.

Karakoram to the rescue! I can t thank enough the staff who ll even after closing helped me with the food. I was late and hungry and specially the staff tonight, Manjyot and I forgot the name of the other lady, both being kind enough to help me place an order. I really appreciate them going out of the way.

The quality and taste of their Chicken and Mutton is authentic and different. I would highly recommend those who really want to taste the best chicken in town. Specially their Balti chicken, Handi Chicken and Biryani s. The species combination is lit

We are British Pakistani family visiting Vancouver. After searching on Google came across this restaurant. Really happy that we made the right choice. We ordered a full Tawa and a lamb karahi. Both were exceptional. Kids and ladies all enjoyed the food. Will definitely recommend everyone
We went twice in a row, the food was delicious ,friendly and helpful service. The  Namak Mandi Karahi was another level,the spices it just perfect. We also enjoyed the drinks Mango lassi and Floooda.

I had the pleasure of visiting Karakoram restaurant, and I could not be happier with my experience! The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The food was cooked to perfection - every dish was full of flavor and truly delicious! I would highly recommend this place if youre looking for an enjoyable night out in town. Five stars from me

Food was freshly cooked, very tasty and every dish was unique. The naans were freshly and hot and very fluffy. The only thing missing was salad and raita not served with the food, otherwise staff was very receptive although restaurant was very busy. Will recommend Pakistani to have Pakistani taste here.
Environment was neat clean and peaceful Service was great pricing is also good enough * The girl on the reception was super nice

Khushman is awesome and the service is excellent. She is a great barista and she makes good lime soda . The food is delicious . The biryani and the grilled chicken Tikka is fabulous . The service is seamless and the food arrived at impeccable timing .
Im amazed by their customer service. They are so kind and catered all my requests. The food is delicious and Id definitely recommend their K2 platter and Chicken Biryani. Im a fan!!!

Ayesha is the best server and the reason come to this restaurant, excellent service. Sanjay is an exceptional cook and a valuable asset to Pakistani cuisine in Vancouver. I came with a new guest and haf Pindi Chicken and Dum Biryani. Taste is awesome .....hats off Sanjay bhai

Karakoram restaurant is a wonderful place that celebrates the art of cooking. With its mouthwatering Biryani, flavourful Nihari, yummy shakes, and expertly prepared mutton dishes, this restaurant has made a special place in my heart (and stomach!). If youre looking for an authentic and unforgettable dining experience, I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to Karakoram Restaurant. Your taste buds will thank you!

I was so impressed with the service and the food. The fries were so crispy, and they were very delicious just like the rice. The butter chicken, perfect spicy-ness! The wings; the dip was so delicious it was minty and spicy.  I recommend that you go and try out the new restaurant in the area.

Excellent Service and food with generous portions! We ordered a full Paneer Karachi for four. Flavourful and authentic! If you like chai, this restaurant has one of the best i ve had in the lower mainland.

I just tried Karakoram for the first time and I must say their chicken karahi is out of this world and Rehanna was an amazing server She was very attentive and sweet. Overall experience was great! Would recommend to anyone. Need their karahi recipe

I live in Victoria and there are no Pakistani restaurants here. I ve been craving Pakistani food for a while and the food at Karakoram satisfied all my cravings completely. We ordered Chicken Biryani, Koila Karahi, Shami Kabab, Mango Lassi and Rabri Falooda. We absolutely devoured everything. And to top it off, the service was brilliant. Highly recommend!! P.S. DEFINITELY TRY THEIR CHAI!!

It s my first experience at middle eastern restaurant, and I am loved with the hospitality and food quality. Our server RIHANA took great care of us with a warm smile, she s familiar with multiple languages, so impressed with that. Highly recommend!!

Food are so awesome and people are accommodating. Start from the host which so polite, kind, and smile so sweet and  server are all hardworking and active. Place is so clean and organize. We had a great experience, I highly recommend to everyone this restaurant and definitely come back.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Ananya thank you for your feedback we really appreciate your business looking forward to serve you soon thank you

review_text: I went with a group of friends when Karakoram had setup ifthar (buffet meal after sunset during Ramadan month) for guests at $38/head. We were going there for quick bite and so, did not fancy a full buffet. Yet, the management was considerate to seat us and accept a la carte orders. We ordered the Lahori and lamb kebab with naan. The flavors were fresh and meat was juicy and tender. The Lahori went really well with the naan. I would certainly come back to try other types of karahi dishes. Parking: Free street parking is available

I ve been to this place a few times. The food is really nice but the portion of Biryani is very less sometimes. The staff is rude sometimes but the two new hires are quite friendly. Their karahis are a must try! The place is open till 1:30 am so that s a perk!! U should visit there on Wednesdays because they have a special Wednesday biryani for only 12$

Mashallah today the chicken biryani was just on another level. I could firmly say that it was one of the best biryanis I have ever had. This is coming from someone who has had Biryani in Pakistan and India. Brother Qasim thank you for the preparation. Will continue to enjoy the tasty Biryani and Karahis!

The food and service was excellent. The servers are very friendly and accomodating. The beef bhuna is among the best that I have ever eaten. We had the fish pakora, chicken pakora, BBQ chicken, Beef bhuna, Koila chicken karahi. Lahori mutton karahi, butter and chilli naan. All tasted really good. The sweet lassi had a bit of a saltiness to it which was good however you can ask for splenda if you dont like the saltiness. The mango shake was good as well. We were a group of 7 and everyone loved the food/service. Food takes a bit longer to be served but they are packed with customers which makes sense. Overall I give this place 5 stars.

Excellent food and lovely service! Just walked in here spontaneously having never tried Pakistani food and it was incredible! We asked for recommendations and got the Karahi and a Grill Platter and both were 10/10. A bit on the pricy side for a family restaurant but you absolutely get what you pay for, it s quality.

One of the most authentic restaurants around. Would like to specially mention Awais who was I think in all black attire, serving us. A gem of a guy and he made our experience completely worth it. Will visit soon again.

First of all, the food was great. Seems like a family owned small restaurant . This isn t your  listen to live music while eating  kind of place but the food was 10/10. Do check it out if you are foodie like me. Visiting from Edmonton this restaurants food just blew my mind.

The food was really so yummy and tasty. We all love the food. We have ordered veal Biryani BBQ plater Chicken Malai Boti Chana Daal and authentic karahi chicken and Roti naan and lassi. Trust me we finished them all special licking the karahi and chutni bowls. Strongly recommend to everyone who visit to Vancouver Wish them all the success endeavours Ameen Parking: Nice location at the corner all side

I recently dined at Karakoram restaurant and had the pleasure of trying their Karahi dishes. I must say, the experience was quite impressive. If you re a fan of flavourful Karahi dishes and warm hospitality, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

I tried Chicken Karhai, K2 Mix Grill, Mutton Bhuna and Chicken Biryani. Out of all items that I ordered, Chicken Karhai and K2 Mix Grill was super delicious. Everything else was good too. Service was excellent and I got to meet the chef. Overall a wonderful dining experience. We finished off our dinner with the best chai in Vancouver.

Being inhabitants of Hunza, the Karakuram,  when searched for Pakistani food in Vancouver, Karakuram Restaurant caught our eyes instantly. Our family loved and enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere thoroughly. Will visit again and recommend other too.Good luck Qasim.

Travelled all the way from Saskatchewan to Vancouver and tried many different Arab and South Asian restaurants but couldn t find that unique and exotic Pakistani and Oriental touch in the food that I ve found at this restaurant. Felt at home as soon I entered and saw the Pakistani flag hung on the wall. Excellent customer service and the staff was was very kind, nice and welcoming. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to the people looking for real Pakistani food!

Really Amazing food and service.. Even though the restaurant was so busy , but the servers really did a great job. Specially the guy name Shudiptho has explained us each and every menu , what it contains and how does it will taste ,It was really helpful. I loved their Karahi  Everyone should try it . The biriyani was bit hard, but I liked the spiciness  I recommend this restaurant for karahi  The best one in city  Will visit again ..

We dined in yesterday, had a karahi and Mutton Biryani. The food was fine but I really enjoyed the service, especially the ambiance. Manager was super welcoming and sweet, really enjoyed the experience.

I went with my other two friends today. The food was excellent and so was the service from an exceptional staff member  Hasan  bhai. Such a great place to hang out to spend some quality time!! Especially if someone  desi craves for the traditional dishes outside home!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Ariful hasan thank you for your feedback looking forward to serve you in style Team k2

review_text: Yesterday went with my uncle and friend. Desi style lahori karahi reminded me of Pakistan. Such a tasty karahi and excellent customer service. The only concern is that there should be more servers in busy times. Definitely would recommend this restaurant.

Amazing food and amazing people. Rihana, one of the staff members spreads very positive vibes. She and one other lady over there enhanced our experience with their restaurant. Their chef, Mr.Sanjay is also a good man had nice talk with him. Shukriya!

Everything from the food  to dessert was delicious!There were alot of amazing options to choose from.The really good thing is that the food is halal. The place was really great, organized, and clean as well as the washrooms and everything. Everyone was so welcoming. Staff were really nice, accomodating, and cooperative. Kid-friendliness: The staff was really nice, they smiled and chatted with the kids all along. Even the chef gave each of the kids a lollipop. Kids felt really happy and loved the restaurant!
Food was delicious, fresh and authentic. Service was very efficient. The staff helped make tasty recommendations.

Love everything about this place, food is fresh,  tasty and well presented,  nice and clean restaurant, lovely atmosphere, very good location and best of all great customer service!! Highly recommend. Food

This is my 4th visit here and Ive finally decided to give a review. We came here for my brothers birthday and was amazed at the service we received. That alone deserved 5 stars. Everyone from the kitchen came out and sang happy birthday which I was shocked about. The food is amazing. I highly recommend the Lamb Karahi and Haleem dishes. Not many places you can truly find authentic Pakistani cuisine. Keep up the good work.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Alex thank you for your feedback and recommendations it was our pleasure to serve you looking forward to serve you in style Team K2

review_text: There karahi are the bomb. Reminds me of Pakistan. There bbq is pretty good too. Limited parking available. It is a bit on pricier side. They were super nice the restaurant was not opened yet but they still let us in and served us food. Thank you Vegetarian options: They have veggie dishes Parking: There is very limited parking at the rear side, you should increase your parking space
Really good food! We asked our server (a very helpful and friendly lady) what she would suggest and we loved it all. Highly recommend.

A nice place to have halal food. Food was really delicious. Although Its little bit expensive but it worths. Perfect place to go with family. I went twice back to back as I was travelling Vancouver. It was the best Halal restaurant to me in Vancouver. I think this is one of a very few halal restaurant that is open late night.
Very good service. Rihana and Arpita did a great job. The food was perfect, so many options even for vegetarians. Would recommend to everyone!!!
Had a wonderful time at this restaurant. The Namak Mandi Karahi was absolutely amazing, and I definitely recommend it. The waitresses were also very helpful and welcoming. 5/5

Oh my gosh! This place is my favorite. I dont go very often since its not that close to where I live, but I wish I could keep going back every time. The food tastes so rich, creamy and flavourful that it makes me so happy. Recently, I went with my dad and it was his first time trying the food there..he LOVED it!! He said that it tasted exactly like how it was back home. The waiting time was only around 15 minutes since we were there as soon as it opened. The customer service is friendly and the seating is comfy too. The only light criticism I would have would be that they charge even for a tiny side dish of lettuce, onions or other veggies; but its only around a dollar and other dishes are reasonably priced. I guess it might be because they are a small business right now & inflation is on the rise so I dont mind very much. Overall, I definitely recommend going to this restaurant, itll be worth it!
Excellent food and service. All karahis were served piping hot and were portioned well. Ayesha took great care of us and we cant wait to come back!
The food was Amazing. Kababs won our heart. Chicken Karahahi was very tasty and flavory. Servers were friendly. Loved the atmosphere. Will visit this place again for sure Food : 5/5

Ive been to this place a few times and I have very few complains. The staff is helpful, the location is beautiful and the food is delicious - not much else one can ask for. Side-note: Their Goat Biryani is the best Ive had in Vancouver! Their chef is a legend and Im surprised the place isnt packed.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Salman thank you for your feedback and recommendations looking forward to serve you in style next time thank you Team K2

review_text: All the food was delicious   highly recommended. The staff is very kind. We are definitely coming back

Karakoram has some of the best non-vegetarian curries in Vancouver, be it chicken or mutton. There is a good selection of curry types, each sufficiently different from the other to not feel similar(like a lot of other restaurants). Must try: 4 types of Karahi Chicken(1/2 serves 2 and full serves 4-5), Mutton Nihari, and Haleem(served Pakistani style, instead of Hyderabadi) Also serves glass bottle cokes for the proper South Asian feel!
The food and the service were excellent, especially the fish pakora very fresh and good portion.
Real high end taste of Pakistan/Indian Cuisine. Loved every dish we have ordered and service was great.
It was overall good experience. The staff was so good. One of the staff also gave us sweets because it was my birthday. They were really kind and helpful.

Simply among the best Indian food in Vancouver. Visit this little gem if you love authentic South Asian cuisine. Their chai is a must have. Special thanks to our fabulous hostess, Ayesha. I will surely go again!
Amazing staff - they were very welcoming and sweet! And the food was fantastic too! Highly recommend the pindi kabab karahi!! Food
Great food! The lamb Karahi  was worth the wait! Super friendly she name Ayesha was so helpful and kind! Highly recommend!
We have always enjoyed their food and experience! Love going here with my family! The falooda drink was out of the world! Thanks for the great experience always, you never disappoint me! :)

Always a great experience at Karakoram. Discovered this place a year ago and it s definitely on my top list of favourite restaurants. A awesome place to dine in! As busy as it looks the staff are always welcoming, friendly and insuring you are enjoying your meal. Food always comes hot from the oven, flavourful and tender. I have not been disappointed. Had my first delivery experience yesterday. I was skeptical on ordering directly from the website as I wasn t sure what the reply period would be... They were quick to respond, made it an easy process to order and food came quickly and just as hot as if ordered in the restaurant.  I would encourage more to order directly from the website as the delivery service was just as great as the in dining experience. My favourite dish the Full order of the chicken Kahari. Huge portions that last me days!!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Lauren, Thank you so much! It s wonderful to hear such feedback, makes us want to even better our services. Really looking forward to serve you again! Team K2

review_text: Karakoram Restaurant in Vancouver is a hidden gem! Their Koyla karhai, Beef seekh kabobs, and Malai boti were simply outstanding. A must-visit for authentic Pakistani cuisine lovers!

Some of the best butter chicken I have ever had. I have passed this place for years and never went in but man am I glad I did. I got their butter chicken pasta and was not disappointed. Huge portion, great flavor, the perfect amount of spice for me. Would recommend and I will be back to try more of the menu.

People sometimes forget we have a lot of diversity in this town! Jambo is great for African and Indian flavours. The menu reflects this and is split into two sections. Service friendly, food even better!

I always love the food here its absolutely delicious and flavorful. The waitresses were really nice and attentive too. The atmosphere is really calm and quiet and its a great place to catch up with friends or family. Highly recommend

Food was great. Service was ok. They assumed we had other party members coming since the table for two wasnt cleaned up so they sat us at a four people table. Then proceed to ignore us for quite a while and not even offering water until we ordered by looking at the menu online.

The whole experience was nice, tried their combos that were available which came with kabab tandoori chicken ribs sides along with appetizers and desserts. The food was great specially the ribs were great. Totally recommend for anyone looking for good kababs

First time to try both dishes and my friend and I enjoyed it so much. One dish is good for 2 people. Mildly spicy and flavorful, yogurt on the side balances the heat. Great customer service. Fish looks big but not a lot of meat though. Still, I think price is reasonable for the serving size. Fries are crispy and not too salty. Will definitely consider going back here to try other dishes.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Grace,                                                                                                  Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you had a 5 star experience with us. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: Four of us went for dinner based on the recommendation of some friends. Each one of us picked a selection from the Africa section of the menu and loved our meal. The mango lassi was the best Ive had in Vancouver (my dessert). The service was prompt and friendly, the music wasnt loud and annoying, and the temperature in the restaurant was also pleasant (I usually need to keep my coat on at restaurants because it is too cold). Vegetarian options: There were several vegetarian options. I enjoyed mine (with spinach, kale and delicious spices).

The food is so good! Whether youre vegetarian or an omnivore you will enjoy the variety of choices and flavors. The service is good but when theyre busy but sometimes its a wait to get the servers attention if theres a large group. But, in my opinion, where their large groups that means the restaurant is good! Vegetarian options: Bhel Puri

Super tasty dinner! This was our first time eating in, last time we ordered. Very much worth a visit, nothing beats fresh. Delicious curries, lamb popsicles, chapati and deep fried tilapia. Really enjoyed the flavors, and the delicious sauces on the side. Attentive and friendly service. You can tell they take a lot of pride in their food. Everything came quick and piping hot. Appealing decor and nice atmosphere. Looking forward to going back and trying more things on the menu. Parking: Lots of free street parking.
I had an amazing time and the food were of big portions and Absolutely delicious.  Highly recommended. Wonderful staff and the food didnt take long to be served.

5/5 must go if you re in Vancouver! The food is an awesome blend of African + South Asian flavors. We loved the mishaki, ribs, and samosas! The wait staff and owner were also very friendly and checked in with us. Great food, atmosphere, service, and prices!

Great presentation. Good food and really quick service. The fish was well done so was the Sukuma Wiki. Was nice to try out these African cuisines first time with a new friend. Apparently one of the rice dishes wasnt authentic. Was substituted with basmati. Masala Chai tea was delicious and bottomless too. Too bad I had to leave in such a hurry to pickup a coworker. Our choices are our options. Our actions speak louder than words. Follow your heart. Love does not judge. 143. Parking: Street with meters.

I always come here. It shouldn t be more than two weeks that I revisit this place. I have built this connection with a lot of people working here and it feels like family too. They treat you like as if they re you re own. And the food, is beyond exceptional!!! Pure East African style and I love it. I keep introducing new friends here and they leave the restaurant filled with amusement! This restaurant is always busy, be sure to book in advance! We always come here last minute because we know we ll get the restaurant to ourselves :D
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Amar for taking the time to write a review for us. Love to hear that you really liked our food and services. Looking forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you
