review_text: This was such a nice treat for me on a hot summer evening. Friends of mine brought me here . They have been here three times in the last month and a half. So of course I wanted to find out about all the hype . So its a mixture of styles. Some INDIAN &some AFRICAN. I was intrigued. My friends tried the vegetable curry and the chicken , beef, shrimp satay. Its smelled so good. They had a side of rice and a dessert which I cant remember the name. They enjoyed it. I had the chicken biryani and fell in love. Such big pieces on the bone. The sauce was so savory and left a nice after taste. Garlic naan was delicious as well. I recommend going and we will be back

Ratings Scale 0 - 10 Variety: 9 Service or Product: 9 Customer Service: 9 Environment: 8 Cleaning: 8 Cost: 7 One of the best places in Vancouver for African or indian cuisine! Excellent protons, taste, as well as quality of service! Loved the overall experience, despite the fact it was slightly pricy. P.S if youre making a reservation theyll automatically charge you 15% gratuity even if your party size is small.

Had a fantastic experience at Jambo Grill for dinner. The staff and owner were great. The owner greeted all the customers and we exchanged similar stories about Africa and India with him. The food and drinks were also exceptional! A must visit if youre in Vancouver!
No other place makes me feel more at home than Jambo Grill !! I love it I will come eat here for every family event from now on!! Food

This is the second African-Indian restaurant I have been to, the first being Simbas Grill where I had some curry that wasnt very good. So, I thought I would try something different. We had complimentary mini drinks that had mango and some herbs in it. Was reall good and I hope they have it in their menus later. I ordered the Cassava fries and the African Chili Chicken with pili pili sauce. The sides were fries and pili pili corn. I had the Cassava fries with medium spice and it was great. Perfectly fried. I feel it is better than the ones I had at Simbas Grill. Im not sure what pili pili tastes like but the chicken with pili pili tasted really different from the pili pili corn. The sauce for the chicken was delicious. The spice adds up overtime was it wasnt overly spicy. The chicken was moist. The fries were also really crispy and well done. The corn however, were tough and the sauce was different and did not taste as good as the pili pili for the chicken. I had a taste of the Lamb biryani and I felt many Indian places can do the dish better. Im not sure how good their curry is but the 5 stars is for the chili chicken and cassava fries.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Kate we appreciate your feedback and kind words. We will share this with our team! Hope to see you again, we have many items on the menu Im sure you will also fall in love with :)

review_text: Decent food in a good ambience! Their platters are very filling and taste well. Service is very much appreciated. Personally I didn t like their  Tilapia Fish  with Pili pili sauce on top. Maybe it was too saucy for me. Nonetheless it was flavory and a bit expensive though. Look forward to try their other courses in future! Highly recommend..if you need to try some different cuisine

My first time but not the last. The restaurant serves wide variety of both Indian and African dishes. Theres really a lot to choose for and we all enjoyed our food. The African menu contains names and flavours that were new to us. The server was really helpful and helped us to navigate through the menu options. It was lunch and the place was mostly quiet, without much of a vibe but maybe evenings are different. Regardless, it certainly worth at least a few more visits

Best food ever! I would advise, food here is little different from a regular Indian restaurants so ask them what you dont understand and you will get the best advice from them. Staff is super helpful, pleasent and welcoming. Great cocktails!

It was a lovely place,  we called before to book a table. When we got there,  we had to wait a short while until a table was free. The food was good. We ordered a platter,  it came with alittle bit of everything... Kebab, Mushkaki, BBQ chicken, and some I think t-bone steak... It comes with a choice of 2 items, rice, fries or potato... They had a separate kids menu which comes with complementary   lollipop candy and 1 juice and 1 Chapman ice-cream cup and a candy....  The kids menu has an activity for them to keep busy while they wait for the the food.  Their service was quick,  they kept us comfortable and kept coming to ask of we were ok and needed anything and finally towards ask if the food was good,  which it was.  We ordered some naan and Mary Bhajias on the side too,  it was overall an amazing experience...  Would recommend anytime!

Indian/African joint, located in a primary Chinese Asian area of east Vancouver. Fusion food at its finest. Absolutely love their Pili Pili Mogo.. we just basically deep-fried cassava root tossed and chili garlic paste, which taste amazing.

I had a good time with my friends at the restaurant. Started by sipping the flavorful Masala Chai and felt like I havent had a better one anywhere in Vancouver before. Bel Puri was good. I wasnt expecting potatoes in a Lamb Biriyani, but it was good. Also had Roti with mild spicy Lamb curry and it was good too. Thank you!

I went there after hearing a lot of positive reviews about this place and I would say I wasn t disappointed at all. The food is great and a lot of variety of options from different African countries that makes it hard to choose because they are all looks great and taste DELICIOUS. The place it s self is well decorated and good vibes. The stuff is so welcomed and so friendly. The owner was checking on us and making sure we are happy and satisfied with the service. Highly recommend
delicious food and customer service is excellent, a good place to enjoy
response_from_owner_text: Dear Kimberly,                                                                                                  Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you had a 5 star experience with us. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: It was a pleasure eating here; it is now my 2nd time that i have visited this restaurant. 1st time i was here i was very impressed with the food - although service was slow. But after coming back now, everything was consistent; service was great and food is superb!!!- i like the authenticity of the flavour components of all the dishes i have tasted and i enjoyed every experience. Jambo grill you will be expecting me a lot of times here, watch out!!!! Lol. Thank you, Loved it. / the decor makes you feel like you are in another country too. / See you soon!

Excellent food - we had both Indian and African dishes and we enjoyed everything. Pro tip: get their delicious chai tea to go with your meal - its flavorful and fresh. Also, we experienced great service from all the servers and the owner.

Jambo grill was a pleasure to eat at. The owner of the grill came and greeted us. The service was excellent and did timely checks to see if we needed anything and the place was well decorated. This restaurant is also complete fire for birthdays. They do a complimentary ice cream with little fire sparks coming out of it. They also play a famous happy birthday song that absolutely makes the environment ecstatic. 10/10 would recommend. As for the food. It is well plated and has large portions. but its a little pricey. wouldnt recommend the butter chicken unless u like less creamy butter chicken sauce and a different taste. The biryani is really good and Id def recommend. Id also recommend the Marsala fries and pili pili mogos but they are a bit spicy. the chai taste exactly like African chai which is delicious. Overall good restaurant, aesethically pleasing. dont use the washroom though. Parking: Good amount of of parking. It is tolled parking and on a busy city street however there is residential parking u could use and free parking underground.
Veryyy good food. You gotta go with someone who knows what to order cause it can get confusing, but taste really good. Will definitely come back.

Such good food, good atmosphere, friendly service. Love coming here for date nights or even as a group, amazing indo-african cuisine. The BBQ is to die for, and the indian food is amazing with the east african spin. Ribs, Naan, Vimto, Paan, they have it all.

Jambo is still open for Takeout, Delivery and Dining in . I ordered Dal Bhajia, which is deep fried Lentil pancake shaped fritters. $6.95 for 5 large servings with Coconut chutney. I was offered 2 for 1 on this item so 10 pieces for $6.95!! Available up until 5 pm. Several other items offered at 2 for 1. Ask for details on other items(Veggie Pakoras) Also had Prawn Popsicles for $13 with some Naan. This dish had a nice lemony flavour. The one drawback was there were only 4 prawns. Total was about $20 and easily enough for 2 meals. Specials change every week. Last visit with 5 friends, I ordered my favourites. Dhal Bhajia, Fried Mogo - Cassava Fries, Tandoori Naan. Really good and the waitress suggested I order some Curry to go with it but I declined. We were all offered a free Mango and mint drink that was delicious and lots of free Masala Chai (see Jamvi Yelp listing)
Great place to have African dishes. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. Definitely recommend this place

Thoroughly enjoyed our dinner party of 14 people here.  Food was absolutely delicious.  Especially the masala fish. Woww!  The flavours explode and just the thought of it sends my mouth watering again!  Cant wait to come back for the masala fish again!

I ll keep this one short. I lived in Nairobi, Kenya for two years and enjoyed the East African cuisine. The Tandoori chicken I enjoyed at this family-centric establishment was SO GOOD, I put my utensils away and went at it like I would in a kibanda. I got emotional seeing the long line of empty Tusker beers (IYKYK), and the warm smiles from both fellow guests and staff. I look forward to my next dining experience here.

I ordered Masai beef ribs through Uber Eats. The size of the rib is indescribable. It was the first African food I tried, and I was satisfied. If you are temporarily unable to serve French fries, please notify in advance.

Update: food is still tasty and good and still would come here again after covid. Not during covid. Waiting area had no spacing. Should tell ppl to wait outside the restaurant rather than all wait inside, making pickups for delivery drivers and take out orders unsafe to collect the food. Could see people were uncomfortable walking out the door since we were all in close proximity. Staff (I think owner) was touching their face, puts mask on, touches outside of mask then walks to a table and starts talking to ppl while touching the table. There was a table of 6 which didnt look like the same household unless 3 couples of similar age live together or the parents had exactly 3 daughters and 3 sons very close in age. Maybe not the role of restaurant to enforce restrictions on guests but again, made me feel that this place is not safe during covid and Ive been to places where the largest group during this current restrictions was 3, max 4 ppl. felt very uncomfortable so Ill wait until after covid to eat here or takeout. Food was good though. Food was good, service was friendly!!

Less options for vegetarians in meals. We tried Pasata - Paneer butter which was good. enough for 2 people. Do not order chilli paneer if you are expecting gravy. We had to replace it with butter paneer to eat with naan. They have good options for vegetarians in starters. Vegetarian options: Less

We always come back here for the amazing food, great service and very friendly staff!! Underground parking access is at the back of the building or you can park on the street. A lot of menu options to choose from, great portions for the price. Halal food! Bottomless masala chai!
I really enjoyed the food which I ordered. The quality and tender of the meat is very delightful. Love this place. Food was not that spicy but the quality and quantity of the food is really good.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Mathesh,                                                                                                 Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you had a 5 star experience with us. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: I wanted to try some pani puri and this place showed up with good reviews. In the picture is the pani puri with naan and butter chicken that I ordered. The sauce for the butter chicken was a bit too salty for me but the taste was still great. I can t tell you if there was a decent amount of chicken in there cuz all I cared about was the sauce lol. Having the raw onions left over from the pani puri helped to refresh my palette to eat more butter chicken. I would to go to the restaurant in person and try the food hot off the grill. Thank you for the food!
I had the curry platter with ground chicken curry and mixed vegetable curry + a creamy lemonade and they were all SUPER tasty.
Great food, child friendly and courteous staff! A return to place and favourite to take out of town visitors every time!

Awesome authentic East African dishes with an Indian twist, at its best! Thank you for bringing back what can only to be tasted in traditional recipes. Simply a one of a kind restaurant! We love the vibes and decor!
I have been here many times, one of my favorite places for large family style meals with a large groups. Always leave with my stomach stuffed.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Efsar for taking the time to write a review for us. Love to hear that you really liked our food. Looking forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you

review_text: I enjoy the restaurant; the staff is very friendly, and the food is fantastic.
They put their heart and much effort into all their dishes. You can taste the freshness! So grateful for this restaurant! Thank you

I was recommended this restaurant by my boss and I have been going here every week since! The kebabs are so good, they melt in your mouth! The Mughlai chicken sizzler is out of the world. The butter chicken was amazing! It really reminded me of amazing food from back home! Apart from the food, the service is really good! The manager and the servers are so attentive. They have an amazing vibe that makes dining here a better experience! Must try!!
I don t understand how this place doesn t have a 5 star. Rib platter amazing. Rice and fries soooooo good. Deserts are delicious. I m totally wowed. Amazing experience.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Labeeb,                                                                                                  Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you had a 5 star experience with us. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: Food here is AMAZING. Love it!! After i tried food from here for the first time via SkipTheDishes, i came to dine-in twice within the same week!

This place has really stepped up its game (or maybe it was always amazing?). The chaat (Nash Kachori) special and grilled food (kababs and coconut chicken tikka) was fantastic! Ramesh is the manager that was our host and when he learned that we were not that familiar with the restaurant, he made sure to give us personalized advice about what to order, and told us a bit about the history of this landmark Vancouver restaurant. Hes a great host and made a great dining experience even better. He told us about the Sunday Thali and Puri breakfast which were gonna check out next time. Cant wait!
Great place for family dinner! I am recommending this African-Indian restaurant to everyone! The ribs are amazing.
Really tasty food and drinks. The Mumbasa ice tea is a must try. Ribs are all great. Dessert is great too. Love this place.
response_from_owner_text: Dear Samin,                                                                                                  Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you love our signature drink Mombassa Ice tea. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: While the service was pretty slow (I think they were severely understaffed which is a product of the times and not the fault of the restaurant) they were SO friendly and the food was quite good. The cocktails are quite delicious and very interesting. I had the Africa Passion (pictured) which was light and refreshing and my mom had something they called a Passionfruit Margarita but absolutely not a margarita. Nevertheless it was SUPER tasty. The bartender has a generous pour, which I appreciate I ordered the lamb biryani. The lamb was sooo tender it shredded just by looking at it   the biryani was basically just saffron rice with delicious stew piled on top, but that could be a regional thing; Im more used to Pakistani biryani.
My usual order. Lunch Special: Pasta (Penne) with Chicken, and Chai Tea (all you can drink).  I like this dish. Penne is tender. And Chai Tea.

One of my favorites, particularly jungle ribs and mango shake. Used to go there very often pre-pandemic. Now order via Uber eats (picture includes delivered items, but not in their own packing). Still delicious after 40 min delivery time. They pack the items very well.
Really enjoyed the mini appy special and delicious daar Bhajias. The thali was great too!

Absolutely fantastic food. Always drive past this place, regret not stopping and eating here. A friend of mine suggested this place and we gave it a try. The food is phenomenal! The African dishes we got was something I haven t had before and I can t wait to have it again. The Indian food is better than most Indian restaurants in Vancouver and Burnaby. Will definitely be back.
Their food is so flavourful and most importantly, very consistent. Always a great time at Jambo and if you want to bring your family or friends, their platters are a must try!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Rishavraj for taking the time to write a review for us. Love to hear that you really liked our food. Looking forward to seeing you again soon. Thank you

review_text: I love the food and especially there bottomless chai and the service is pretty good
The mango juice was really good. The atmosphere was nice and the food was really delicious. Its a great place to try Indian/African cuisine

The staff was incredible, the ambiance was inviting. Ample seating and space for a meal that doesnt feel cramped with other diners. Its an Indian African Fusion, with multiple options. Vegetarian, and an item or two that are vegan friendly. The veggie pakora was delicious.
Food was delicious.  Grilled Shrimp and Grilled Beef ribs bone in!   Asked for spicy and it definitely hit the spot
Must try food in Vancouver. The food makes up for the service in my books. Great selection and very easy to get into for beginners that are not familiar with Indian and Ethiopian cuisine.
I really can t wait to go here again because the food is extremely delicious and served with great dips 10/10. Highly recommend to everyone to go here and dine.
response_from_owner_text: Jambo :) Thank you! Hope to see you soon!

review_text: Indian and South African food. Tastes good well I believe there is a scope of improvement required is food .
Ate in the restaurant and it was delicious. Nice portion sizes, fair price, very friendly service. Food
response_from_owner_text: Dear Mx, Jambo !!                                                                                                        Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! Were so happy to hear that you love our food and service. We hope youll join us again soon!

review_text: Food is always too notch...great taste and variety.  Everything from the bhelpuri to the platters to biryani is amazing

Greatest tandoori chicken in Vancouver! Atmosphere is fantastic. Karan is easily the best waiter at Jamdo Grill; very prompt while not being overbearing. He knows what you want before you want it. Be sure to ask for Karan, and you wont be disappointed. I did find the bottom though...

Ive been to Jambo Grill several times over the years. Ive never had a bad meal there. I love their cassava fries, their ribs and their masala potatoes. I brought a couple of friends to Jambo Grill a few years ago, who used to live in Kenya and they absolutely loved the food. Tonight I just ordered delivery. The Pili Pili Mogos are just so flavourful with a bit of heat. I was intrigued, so I ordered the masala sausage. I havent seen that on their menu before. Delicious! It was crispy outside, juicy inside and very tasty. I ordered the veggie samosas. They were crispy and fresh. Im just surprised that their tamarind chutney comes in packets, like ketchup packets from fast food restaurants. Ill still be ordering again.
It is an amazing place to be. Everything have that authentic taste to it. However, its just a bit pricey

What a surprise . Amazing food . So delicious I can easily say best Indian food in the whole of BC though I know it s not an Indian restaurant , it s a fusion .Must try it out . Very reasonable prices.
Great food, unique dishes, good service. Mishkaki Choma is my favourite.
always very good service and food!! my family had a great time
The food here is exceptionally delicious. Highly recommend their Mishkaki Choma, Tandoori Chicken and Appy Platter! When ordering food online, this place has become my primary preference!

My wife and i went outside of our regular comfort zone for dishes and were happily surprised by the food we were served. Great blend of spices on food for a good price! Even though it was quite busy and we had to wait a little bit to be seated, the servers were quite attentive and I believe the owner was even nice enough to give us some tips on which sauces go well with which dishes, plus to not let our Naan bread dry out with our leftovers(secure in airtight bag). Will definitely visit again. I am sure not every dish will be right for us but we are willing to give multiple a try.
Wonderful place to check out! They got great food, and even have their own home made tamarind sauce. Its delicious, check it out!
Delicious food but prices are on the high end. But food is too good. Expensive halal restaurant!

Been here several times now and have been impressed every time.. The food has been consistently well seasoned and really delicious. I dont have any complaints about the service. Theres plenty of selection on their menu. The decor and music are thematic. Their safety protocols for the pandemic have been great. My favourite place to eat in the area.
Excellent fusion of Indian and Kenyan/Ugandan. Great Kenyan ambience with Indian touch. Delicious chai. Reminds me of Mombassa.
What an awesome place to dine at! Loved everything

I dined at the restaurant on my final evening in restaurant. The restaurant had a good atmosphere. The staff were attentive and the food was great, definitely value for money. A restaurant s atmosphere sets the stage. It s about more than just a dining room away from home. Food takes the spotlight as guests become its audience. Factors such as music, lighting, artwork and spacing combine to create comfort and intimacy.
Great food and service. Really unique dishes not available other places. They play a fun happy birthday song for their customers who are celebrating.
Great food. I ordered a dish that gave me less than those I came with. Yet still had a hard time finishing my meal. Their curry is great.
Delicious indian food! Absolutely loved it!

I am having difficulty finding the words to describe how delicious the food here was. This is a fusion between African and Indian food in all of the best ways. We stuck primarily to the African menu, mostly for the meat. The spice blend is fragrant, flavorful, and the type of spicy that has so much flavour you dont really care that your mouth is burning a little...you just want that next bite because its so good (and I dont do spice usually). The boneless ribs were a favorite for our group. I dont give out 5 stars very often, so please dont change anything about your food! We will definitely be back (and ordering in).

Not many Indian food restaurants are as authentic as this place. Food took a little while but truly amazing. The service was great and the owner (also the cook) came out to see how we all were doing and if we were enjoying the food. If youre looking for good Indian food. This place easily makes my top 3 and on a good day #1! Dont hesitate. Top quality service and food!
Amazing place. Best East African fusion food in Vancouver. Ribs and kebabs so tasty. Very friendly service.
Amazing food and desserts - owner/manager is very kind.

I visited for the second time. I would highly recommend this for Indian/ middle east/ south asian people who love a bit of spice (adjustable ofcourse) in food kababs or biryani or curries. I had lamb biryani and kababs which were really nice. The second time i had thali which was also good.

Discovered this eatery through recommendation s from a friend and they were spot on!  This is one of the hidden hole in the wall Jems that Vancouver is famous for.  A mix of Indian and South African inspired fare with some really amazing dishes!! (The ribs are awesome).  What really impressed me however, being a fan of spicy food, is that the spice isnt burn-your-mouth and still tasting it hours later.  This is well balanced, flavorful and really easy on the palate.  Highly recommended!

Good food and something different from your usual Chinese/Indian/Canadian/American fare. We asked the waiter to order for us and had a great experience. They make their own tamarind sauce in house, I love that stuff. Reserve ahead if you have more than six and its a peak time like Friday/Saturday nights. They have a lunch menu available and a brunch menu for weekends.
Authentic and tasty! I love this place would eat all my meals here everyday if I could. I love the tastes and aromas of the food. I hope I can eat here forever

During these crazy times with the pandemic, Jambo has used the utmost care and gone above and beyond to do everything in a safe manner. We didnt know exactly where to go to eat our food when we ate it, but since it was a few hours before closing, the manager let us eat in a corner, while socially distancing (it was only 4 people spaced out). The manager/owner and server at the time were wonderful with their hospitality, the food was amazing, and they went out of their way to provide us with everything we needed. This small gesture made us feel like everything was back to normal for a brief moment, which was almost as good as how amazing their food is, which is truly the best in town. I cannot recommend Jambo enough they have great staff, fantastic ownership, and phenomenal food. Definitely my favorite spot in Vancouver.
Delicious food and great value for money

We really love the overall ambiance and service of this restaurant. The staff was always welcoming and accommodating. Special mention to Lalit who had been very entertaining during our last visit. Personal recommendations and crowds favorites were also introduced. We also appreciate the fact that we were challenged to try other dishes, and not just stick to our personal favorites. Our last visit was a pre-birthday dinner of my boyfriend. We were delighted as a simple yet thoughtful birthday special was brought to the table for us to enjoy. Not to mention that all of our orders were very flavorful! I highly recommend this place to everyone who wish to have a great time and enjoy East African and Indian cuisines.

Amazing food. I suggest the Mobasa iced tea to compliment your meal. The service is lacking and really could be better, but thats how the service industry is today. The food makes up for the service. Its worth multiple visits. If you work there and you read this, please treat everyone with the same respect. Thank you. ******* Update! I was at Jambo on Sunday July 11th, 2021, with about 20 minutes left before closing. Since my last visit, the customer service has been ramped up a notch and it made for a great atmosphere. The food is always great and the service just got better. I recommend this place to anyone who likes a little adventure and wants to add a bit of spice to your life. 5 star.
We visit Jambo Grill often and have never been disappinted. Food is excellent and service is great. Owner Nash is always around making sure customers are doing good.

My favourite place in the whole neighborhood. This is one of those cant miss places where whatever I order I have enjoyed.  Like I could literally close my eyes, stab my finger at the menu, and be happy with what I ordered. Also try the specialty drinks.  My favourite is the Mombasa tea (with mango and mint).  It is so refreshing. For those who are not adventurous, I recommend the jungle ribs.  A pleasant dish for the pickiest of eaters.

The food is so unbelievably good, and the service is unbeatable. Literally everyone that works here are so nice and funny! Its a very upbeat and friendly atmosphere. I really recommend this place for amazing food and service. Cant wait to come back and try more dishes! (highly recommend their iced tea, butter chicken, and masala fries + fish)

Ive been wanting to visit this place for a while now, and today I was in the neighborhood and saw that it was opening at 7, so I got there just before they opened, and it was still dark. I saw them going into the cafe and many of the employees of the supply store they are located at. Had no idea it was at a lumber and hardware supply warehouse, surrounded by many other commercial warehouses, such a great surprise, which just makes it that much better. Absolutely loved the atmosphere and the owners. Very friendly older couple and their son run this awesome famiky owned cafe. Awesome home cooked breakfast, amazing friendly and relaxed service, and unbelievable atmosphere. When I got there, I was the only one, but I still loved it so much. The old school diner style furniture and music were awesome. I got the pancake with blueberries, sunny side up eggs, and sausage, which were all very good. Loved their old small glass coffee maker and the mugs. The son who was serving was very nice and friendly....he me told me that this place has been around since the 1940s and his parents got this place 15 years ago have been in the business for so long after they retired, wanted to have a slow and small place and now this place is exploded and is crazy busy ...which I find very funny and awesome. Will definitely come back to try their burgers and Chinese food.

Finally got to try this little gem on a holiday Monday. We waited 1.5 hrs but it was worth the wait. This place is the perfect example of an unpretentious, no fuss family run restaurant that focuses on delicious comfort food. The staff were warm, welcoming and attentive.

This place is a jewel in Vancouver. From the very unexpected entrance, to the warmth of the staff to the amazing food. Everything you need to have a beautiful experience. No fancy coffee drinks that are replaced for an absolutely amazing food experience. Everything is cooked to perfection, from fresh ingredients never frozen. The flavors are an experience. That are accompanied by the smiles of every staff member. The place is cozy and comfortable. The house wonton soup is really great, a mix of flavors and expertly served. The hash browns the best! Don t forget your cash or debit, your credit cards are not welcome here  :) Parking: In front of the building, do not park on the spaces designated for other business

This is an amazing place for breakfast, and lunch. The place located in the middle of the factories places, and we need to go upstairs and feel like home. The restaurant is hidden in the area, and this is spectaular place, and with delicious foods. The omelette is very delicious and with the hash brown which flattered down like a sheet. The eggs just cooked perfectly, and the hash brown is thin and tasty It is recommended to go for eating!!!

I keep coming back to this cozy place for breakfast/lunch. I LOVE their shredded hash browns   . The family who runs this restaurant is super friendly! I brought my parents to eat the other day, and the owner came over to chat with us. Thank you for sharing your story with us, it made our visit super memorable.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Alice, Thank you for taking the time to write this amazing review. So glad you enjoyed the shredded hash and had a great time with us!! We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: After hearing so much about Northern Cafe, my anticipation was high as I finally made a reservation to dine at this much-acclaimed establishment. The decision to reserve a table proved to be wise; we were seated almost immediately upon arrival, avoiding the long wait times that had deterred us during a previous attempt to dine here. Dont be fooled by its surprising location or the state of the building (which might seem to some as if it were about to collapse at any moment).  Inside is something you wont find anywhere else in Vancouver! The atmosphere at Northern Cafe is inviting, reflecting its family-run ethos. The menu offers a variety of comfort food options, and we opted for burgers and a side of poutine. The food was exceptional each bite of the burger was a blend of flavors and textures, and the poutine was a delightful mix of crispy fries, cheese, and well-balanced gravy. What stood out, even more, was the service. The staff were attentive and courteous, enhancing the overall dining experience. Its evident why this establishment has garnered such high praise and even topped lists of the best places to eat in Canada. A particularly charming touch was the inclusion of watermelon slices with our meal. It added a refreshing contrast to the hearty fare and demonstrated the restaurants attention to detail. Another delightful aspect was the handwritten reviews by children displayed on the wall, which actually helped us make our menu choices. Northern Cafe lives up to its reputation. The combination of delicious food, excellent service, and a welcoming atmosphere makes it a must-visit. Making a reservation is highly recommended!

If you are desperate for comfort, then this friendly family run cafe will brighten your day! The hash brown is a must have, thin and crispy. The pork chop sandwich was tasty, as the meat was well marinated and juicy. Brighten my day especially in this awful rainy weather!

Our first time visiting! Located in a unique location paired with great food made for a lovely visit. Service was warm/friendly and quick. The place seems to have a lot of regulars, which says a lot when there are so many eatery options in Vancouver. We will be back!

Definitely one of a kind and one of a few left in the city! The food: solid staples and honestly, you cannot go wrong with anything here. The owners and staff were lovely despite being very busy! Even though the wait can be long (approx 45mins), I think the experience in the end was worth it! Truly a gem and I hope it is here for many years to come!
response_from_owner_text: Hello T Ng, Thank you so much for visiting and so glad you enjoyed the food and experience. We truly appreciate you finding the time to write this review. This means so much to us. We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: A relaxed greasy spoon setting with friendly service. Food is delicious and unpretentious. I always look forward to coming here, especially for the extra crispy hash browns!
Reviews speak for themselves! If you haven t come here yet, you gotta. Waiter was also a very cool dude. Definitely a regular spot for me now!

Almost missed the cafe due to it s location as it is located inside a hardware shop area. Long lines might deter you but be patient because the wait is worth it! Simple food made right is spot on!!! Great for brunch!

Staff was polite and very helpful. It was my first time eating at Northern Cafe and I tried the Deluxe Burger with a small poutine while my friend tried the Steak n  Egg. We also shared a bowl on wonton soup and my friend had a cup of coffee. (Our bill was ~$57 after tip). The portion was good and the quality of the meal was satisfactory. We were both very happy with our food. I have no feedback from my visit and would recommend this place to anyone. Of note, you can expect to wait to be seated as the establishment is small and can be busy, but they offer text notification which was nice.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Willy Thank you for taking the time to post the this great review and the amazing photos! We truly appreciate it! So glad to hear you enjoyed the food and experience! We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: I love this place. It s a hole in the wall for sure, but it actually is amazing. The menu may seem like typical diner fare and Chinese chop suey style items, however, from the ingredients to the way the food is made is certainly anything but typical. Even their burgers are made with AAA sirloin beef. Overall, everything I ve tried here (both breakfast and lunch items) in my multiple times visiting have been very yummy. Don t be fooled by its industrial surroundings and the wobbly stairs leading to the diner, this place is truly a hidden gem and is worth the hype. But make sure you have some time to wait, there is usually a wait time even outside the usual meal time rush.
response_from_owner_text: Hi BY, Thank you for a kind review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: The first thing I will say is that this is by far the best diner Ive been to. The day I write this review is my first time going, and Ill tell you its a diamond in the rough! The cafe is within a lumber yard, and you are required to climb a narrow flight of stairs before entering the diner itself. Upon entering, the environment is very tight-knit and warm, a trademark of a family owned business. The owners and the waiter were all very friendly and gave us fist bumps after realizing it was our first time there. He was also very friendly and checked up on us from time to time to make sure our experience was a satisfying one. The item Ive ordered was the Northern Deluxe burger, which comes with fries, potato salad, and a slice of watermelon to counter the savory meal. I decided to add 3 dollars for the poutine instead, and im glad I made that decision. When the food came, I was instantly salivating from the gorgeous looks of the burger. When I took my first bite, flavors burst into my mouth, and a party took place. By far, its an amazing burger and something to crave for! (I never craved for a burger/sandwich before) While I was enjoying my burger, one of my friends had a spicy chicken sandwich, which also looked appetizing and is something I must try next on my following visit. The Eggs Benedict and the Cheddar burger my other friends ordered also looked equally appetizing as well! All of the choices look amazing and will be things Ill try out in the future. Overall, even though this place is located within a lumber yard, the food and staff blew my mind away. This will officially be my first 5 star review and to put it in simple terms... Northern Cafe, you have mastered your craft. I will be back!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Grim Eater, Thank you for the 5-star review and taking the the to write this. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: Love the charming and quirky location. Of course one of the best cafes I ve ever been to is above a working lumber yard. This place gets busy fast and once you ve dined here you ll understand why. We arrived 7 minutes after opening and within 5 minutes the line was out the door and in the lumber yard. The service is wonderful and the breakfast food is classic greasy spoon diner fare. Important detail when it comes to payment, they only accept local debit cards and Canadian currency. This left us paying via PayPal! It was unexpected yet quite convenient. Love this place!
response_from_owner_text: HI Austin, Thank you for taking the time to write this glowing review! So glad you enjoyed the experience and food! Regarding payment, we try to make it convenient for international guests that visit and thats why we have set up paypal as a payment method. Glad that everything worked out!  We hope you can visit us again soon. Take care! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Real-life diner. Western & Chinese. Not sure when it started. First went in the late 80s early 90s. Dishes and menu are the same, they no longer have sourdough bread though. Still GREAT!
pretty tasty place, wonton soup is nice probably just the wonton instead of the noodle though , hash brown, egg benedict, pancakes are also good. long lineup during lunchtime.

Warm welcoming staff and flavourful food! This cafe is located in a unique place, just above the building supply company. They serve a wide range of breakfast foods and other dishes like Wonton soup! We ordered the pancake combo with sausage. You can customize the toppings for your pancakes (either blueberry or chocolate chips). The pancakes had a fluffy texture and tasted great. I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast or lunch.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Savannah, Thank you for the 5-star review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: We love going for brunch and Northern Cafe has been on our radar for a while to check out. I loved the strange location of it all   a family run restaurant amongst a lumber yard. This place drew in quite the mixed crowd of local enthusiasts/regulars and lunch crew of construction workers and the like. There s something very nostalgic about Northern Cafe and it s this charm that makes for a fun dining experience. I loved that I was able to order Chinese food while my husband ordered western breakfast. This combination serves well in my books and I am glad to have given Northern Cafe a visit. I ll have to go back for the wonton soup as it seemed to be quite the popular dish ordered. I had opted for the potstickers instead (not pictured cause it arrived as the last dish and I forgot to take a pic) but wish I went with the wonton because I didn t think the potstickers were anything special.
response_from_owner_text: HI Anita Thank you so much for taking the time to write this amazing review. We truly appreciate it. Glad you enjoyed the food and experience - and most of all you felt like family here. We look forward to having you back again and  hope you can try our wontons next time!  See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: One of the best hidden breakfast spots in the city. Even though it is difficult to find at first, making your way through the lumber yard, and up through the small staircase adds to the charming experience. The place gets busy and for good reason; affordably priced delicious food, welcoming service, and cozy atmosphere. Ordered the garden omelette and philly cheese steak melt.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Danish, Thank you for taking the time to write this amazing review! We our truly humbled! We Look forward to your next visit! Richard and Raymond

review_text: This place is a hidden gem. Great for breakfast/brunch. Be prepared for long lines!!! Call ahead to place your name in queue before you arrive. The inside of the restaurant is small and cosy. The food is great and you get huge portions for a reasonable price. There s also a lot of options for brunch and they cater to vegetarians. The potstickers (dumplings) were delicious! Will definitely come back again.
response_from_owner_text: HI Valerie Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review. We truly appreciate it. Glad you enjoyed the food and experience - and most of all you felt like family here. Great that you pointed out that we have Vegetarian options. We try to accomodate for all. We look forward to having you back again and do hope you can try our homemade wontons - its a favourite of many. See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: We had an amazing cozy experience, everything was delicious, friendly ambiance and great music. Its a hidden jewel, highly recommended
response_from_owner_text: Hello Barbara, Thank you so much for visiting and so glad you enjoyed the food and experience. We truly appreciate you finding the time to write this review. This means so much to us and we feel the love. :) We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: A wonderful diner in a least expected spot...above a lumber yard! Very friendly and engaging staff. Wonderful food actually made in-house.
The server and the food are excellent there. We ordered Wonton Soup, North Deluxe Burger, and Combination Plate, they tasted so good. We d love to go there one more time.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Lavinia, Thank you for the 5-star review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: Great experience in a lovely place A good family place Excellent, personal service Soul food Took my 5-year-old son here for lunch one time and we had a great time. It was a weekday so we didnt have to wait (expect a queue during peak times). Once we got settled in, I enjoyed my coffee while chatting with my son. Service was quick and kind. We had food of the Chinese part of the menu which was delicious. After our meal, Richard came over to make sure my son and I were taken care of which was super thoughtful. This is a place you need go to at least once (or twice, or three times, ...).
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tim, Thank you for a 5-star review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: I ve heard so many good things about this place I had to try it myself ! I m sure because this place is trending on Tik tok it has become very very busy. We showed up around 11am on a Saturday and there was about an hour and a half minute wait list. We didn t mind waiting we went for a walk. The breakfast to us was worth the wait. It was so delicious, and really made you feel like you were having a nice home cooked meal. The service was wonderful , and everyone was so friendly. I was drinking my coffee and water and whenever it got low immediately without asking they would fill it back up. The hand cut fries were amazing. And the pancake was so yummy and doughy. I would highly recommend coming to check this place out. It s a little hidden to get to and you need to watch out for the very very steep stairs but once you make it to the top , it s very easy to find. Thank so much for the wonderful experience, we will be back again
response_from_owner_text: Hi Madison, Thank you for visiting us and giving us an amazing review! We truly appreciate it! SO happy you enjoyed the food and experience and we look forward to your next visit! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Hearty, warm all day breakfast items to get you started on your day! Comes with free coffee refills.

I ordered the fried chicken egg benny, swiss bacon mushroom burger and combo pancake. And I recommend the Fried Chicken Egg Benny!! The shredded hash is to die for. The eggs plus yolk on the plate tastes so goooooodd.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Fedeline, Thank you for visiting us and giving us an amazing review! We truly appreciate it and means this alot to us. SO happy you enjoyed the food and experience and we look forward to your next visit! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Super friendly and home like atmosphere. Not to mention the food was out of this world! I will definitely be back. Highly recommend! Food

We were lucky to be visiting on the first day of reopening - overheard someone local say that they close the cafe during the winter. The atmosphere is a cross between small town diner, a gas station stop (in a good way), your favorite Chinese restaurant. When you walk in, you definitely get the  when you re here, your family  vibe. We ordered the pancake combo plate with a side of hash and hand cut fries, and 6pc potstickers and coffee. Only regret was not getting 12pc potstickers cause it was delicious - definitely satisfied with everything. The staff is super friendly, hospitable. The praise, (literally posted from floor to ceiling around the cafe), for the food and service is well deserved. There will be a wait (ours was about 35-40min) but it s totally worth it. For international folks   they accept cash USD (no international debit/credit). We can t wait to visit again!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Rediet, Thank you for taking the time to leave this amazing review. So happy you enjoyed the food and experience including feeling like you are the part of the family - you are!! :) We hope you can try our potstickers next time. We look forward to having you back again soon. Richard and Raymond

review_text: Friendly staff,  cozy location, and delicious food.  Must go to if youre looking for some awesome food!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Kareem, Thank you for a kind review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: It was a hidden gem, but not so hidden anymore   Their  ham and egg benny and hashbrowns is still my favourite. The deluxe burger and wonton were ok.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Janis, We appreciate you taking the time to write this amazing review.  Truly appreciate it - So glad to hear you enjoyed the experience and the food. For our Burgers, we use AAA Sirloin and ground our own beef including hand-pressing our Burger patties. Its all made fresh! Hopefully you can try it next time on your next visit. Thank you again and take care! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Authentic Vancouver character in this family run restaurant. Great service, great atmosphere, great breakfast. True gem in the rough, a wonderful place to take family and friends for breakfast or brunch. It s a family run business where it s clear everyone involved is invested in making it a success. Homemade shredded hash browns, homemade hot sauce, engaged server and cook. I ve been exploring restaurants across the Lower mainland and this literally defines what a gem in the rough is.
Like having meal  in time tunnel . 60 s classic pop created a vibe, homey cups, plates, forks and tea spoon like having meal at home

In case you needed to hear an echo of everyone else here, the hospitality of the staff here is on another level. Our first time there and you truly feel like youre just catching up with an old friend. In such a quirky place with ample amount of signage assuring you that youre in the right place and pointing you where to go. Head up a few stairs and turn the corner to be greeted by a neat little diner. The food was fantastic, extremely well portioned and priced! Definitely check it out, if not to at least say you had breakfast at a lumber yard!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Danny, Thanks for taking the time to write your review! We are definitely in a unique location and our culture is to treat our guest like family! We focus on fresh homemade food where you will feel right at home! Much appreciated for sharing your experience and we look forward to your next visit! Raymond

review_text: Northern Cafe and Grill food was amazing, reasonably priced,  the staff when above and beyond the extra mile. My friend has Celiac and the serve accommodated her. Even asked about cross contamination. He said  I care about you  We were floored. To the male server God bless you  . Thank you Dai Lo. Vegetarian options: Was able to accommodated for my friend that has Celiac Diease. Dietary restrictions: Lots of veg options Kid-friendliness: Family friendly
response_from_owner_text: Hi Sylvie Thank you for visiting and dining with us!! Thanks for taking time to leave this amazing review. We truly appreciate it! So glad you enjoyed the food and experience. - yes we do care about all our guests(our extended family) We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Lovely diner, very good quality food. Everything was tasty including coffee! Owner is friendly and service was great too. There are a lot of locals who come (they greeted the owner so thats my guess), return business is always a great sign   not just a fad, but solid food and lovely restaurant. For US travellers, no credit card or debit card accepted, you can pay with US dollar or Canadian dollar.  I would recommend getting some Canadian dollars with you when traveling in Vancouver to get the exchange discount ;)

The food here is not bad, but not super amazing either. Although I personally enjoyed it as classic breakfast food and even though it s simple, everything pairs together perfectly. When you come here, it s definitely for the atmosphere and the amazing service. Would definitely recommend for the experience.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Kristy, Thank you for taking the time to write this review. So glad you enjoyed the experience with us!!  We treat all our guests like family and so happy to hear you felt the love :). Hope to see you back again soon. Please take care! Richard and Raymondp

review_text: Hole in the wall alert! Northern Cafe!!!! Inside a Lumberyard!! 5/5 When I saw on google that it had 4.9/5 stars with over 1000 reviews, I HAD to check this place out! It s a family-run lumberyard homestyle cafe and it did not dissapoint.  The service was excellent!  Mom and Pop cooking away in the kitchen and their 2 sons serving tables.  They took the time to chat with me, see where I was from, explain the menu, and tell me a brief history of the diner.  Most things are hand-made (as opposed to from frozen) and it was superb! 1. Pancakes They were light, fluffy, and slightly crispy.  Probably the best pancakes I ve had ever! 5/5 2. The Northern Deluxe Burger It was pretty good!  Not the best burger I ve ever had, but it definitely hit the spot!  My only suggestion would be add a bit more sauce or do something to it to give it that punch.  I added ketchup to mine. 4/5 3. Hand cut fries Technically this was not a dish, it was just a side to the burger.  But these fries were hand cut (as opposed to from frozen), and they were REALLY crispy!  Give it a few minutes to crisp up as opposed to right away when its fresh from the deep fryer. 5/5 4. Potato Salad Again, this was not a dish but a side to the burger.  I don t like potato salad really but this one was REALLY good!! 5/5 5. Potstickers Another hand-made item from mom!  Not the best I ve had but still pretty good and it definitely hit the spot! 4.5 I would DEFINITELY come back here again and again as I want to try their other menu items! Love where it s located and love how it s family owned and operated.  If you are ever in the area, GO HERE!  It s GOOOD!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Desy, Amazing review and write up! We truly appreciate it! So glad you enjoyed your time with us. Love the content as well and video! We cant wait to have back again soon. Take care! :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: Best greasy spoon around. So rustic. Ironically, not a level surface in the building, despite being built by a lumber shop back in its day. But that adds to the charm. Amazing food. Nothing fancy, just really good. Service is excellent. Prices are just ok, but it really is a destination eatery worth a visit.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Duncan, Thank you for taking the time to write this amazing review! We truly appreciate it and glad to see you enjoyed the food and experience with us. We look forward to having you back again. Happy New Year to you and your loved ones! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: The food here was amazing but what was even better was the hospitality and service from Jimmy. Although this was my familys first time there (and not last time) Jimmy made us feel like family. Did I mention the food was amazing too?    If youre ever in the Vancouver area and need a great start to your day, this is the place!!!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Peter, You are amazing! Thanks for taking the time to write your review! Our culture is to treat our guest like family! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we look forward to your next visit ! Raymond

review_text: This restaurant is a hidden gem in this industrial region. All the food is delicious, especially the hand-shredded hash. All the servers here are friendly and helpful, and most of them know Cantonese too. Just be aware that it does not accept credit cards here, but it is okay to pay by PayPal or even e-Transfer.
response_from_owner_text: HI Vinz, Thank you for taking the time to write this amazing review!! Our hand-shredded hash our loved by many and we are so happy you loved it too! We look forward to serving you again soon! :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: Great food and service. Definitely deserving of their great reviews. It s a Cute little mom and pop shop. There will be a wait so please prepare for that.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Ceecee, Thank you for visiting us and giving us an amazing review! We truly appreciate it! SO happy you enjoyed the food and experience and we look forward to your next visit! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: This is a fantastic place for breakfast or lunch. When you get here, if theres a wait, theyll take your name and mobile number to message you when your table is ready. The restaurant building is really old, it oozes character and Im sure there are many interesting stories from the many years its been in operation. Unfortunately the location wont be suitable for some people with disabilities that would struggle with stairs. Service was fantastic, Richard and the rest of the staff are super friendly - this is a very welcoming restaurant. I think the staff are a major reason this restaurant is great. Last but certainly not least, is the food. The choices are great, prices are reasonable, and everything is a classic in its own right. Although the restaurant was busy with some people waiting, it didnt take long to receive our food. We stuck with breakfast and I must say, it was satisfying. For my mom, she asked for eggs over medium and her reaction was, this is the first time a restaurant has made my eggs perfectly. Were looking forward to another visit sometime soon, well try some lunch options next time.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Pedro, Thank you so much for this glowing review. It was wonderful to have you and your family in yesterday. Glad you enjoyed the food and we made you feel like family! We hope to have you in soon again. Have a wonderful weekend and take care! Richard

review_text: Love the place! Nothing fancy, but with great food and warm and gentle family who runs the cafe. Its really a hidden gem, in case you have a long lay-over in vancouver, you could drop by and wont regret it.
response_from_owner_text: HI Marybeth, Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We truly appreciate it. So happy you enjoyed the food and experience. Now you are part of the family! :) We look forward to having you back again soon. Take care and stay warm! Richard and Raymond

review_text: We got there right when it opened before it got busy. The owner came to chat with us and tell us his story. What an amazing experience, and delicious home cooked food. We will be back again for sure. It takes a little courage to get through the lumber yard without thinking you re in the wrong place. Keep going, it s well worth it.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Matt Thanks and much appreciated for sharing your experience! We are gald you had the courage to walk through the lumber yard! We hope to see you again! Raymond

review_text: 2023: their food consistently heals the soul. Much love thanks Raymond. 2021: Hard nowadays to fine hearty and honest good food such as northern. Years I ve passed it by and didn t realize. Oh boy now I m worried about my waist line. Bravo Mah family.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tim, Thanks and much appreciated for your review! We was definitely our pleasure! We are glad you found us and we look forward to seeing you again soon! Raymond

review_text: Owners were incredibly friendly and passionate about everything they make in the house. My family had such a great chat with them. The service was exceptional and the breakfasts we had hit the spot. Pancake batter were whisked to ordered and the hashbrowns were nice and crispy. Also, their homemade hot sauce is to die for. This diner has been around since the 40s and is a must try hidden gem!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Angela, Thanks for the stars and for the feedback! Food is our passion and family is our inspiration...our culture is to treat our guest like family! Glad you enjoyed our pancakes and our homemade hot sauce! We look forward to your next visit! Raymond

review_text: Its an interesting place to eat from. I was greeted with the scent of BBQ Pork being cooked. The atmosphere was cozy. The patriarch of the family greeted me in Cantonese when he brought our plates over. I found this amusing because his intuition took a chance on me with understanding.  He was also observant that I was a first time guest. The food devoured kept me full. However I promised to visit again so that I can try his Chinese cuisine and see if it can remind me of home.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Siu Hong Lum, Thank you for visiting us and giving us an amazing review! We truly appreciate it! SO happy you enjoyed the food and experience and we look forward to your next visit! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: This our second visit since the beginning of the pandemic. First one was for breakfast (awesome), this visit to try the Asian lunch quisine.  You can tell they handmade certain aspects like the noodles and wonton. Definitely will come again to try the burgers !
response_from_owner_text: Hi Paul, Thank you for visiting us again! So glad you tried our asian dishes and loved it! Our wontons are made with love and glad you tasted it! :) Our burger patties are also all made in-house and we cant wait to have you back. Appreciate you taking the time to write this amazing review! Richard and Raymond

review_text: I absolutely loved and enjoyed the food! They have great customer service paired with a homey atmosphere. The prices on the food are affordable and fair as well. All the reviews are genuine and real! If you havent tried this place yet I highly recommend it!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Joseph, Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review! So thrilled to hear you enjoyed the food and experience - including feeling at home. We look forward to having you back again. See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Great food and friendly service. We live this place! No wonder it s rated as the top restaurant in Canada by Yelp!
response_from_owner_text: Hi James, Thanks for taking the time to write this review and glad your friends and brother enjoyed the time with us.  - feeling the love!  Hope you guys had a fun at the Marathon! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Love the experience, friendly staff (family owned and run).  The food was amazing and highly recommend.  Be prepared to wait in line for a table
response_from_owner_text: Hi Cece Thank you for taking the time to post the this great review and the amazing photos! We truly appreciate it! So glad to hear you enjoyed the food and experience! We look forward to having you back again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Very clean and well kept hole in the wall restaurant, it feels like an old family style diner. The customer service is outstanding. As a local, my partner and I have a great time here every time so if youre tourist def check it out!

Though it may not look like much and its location is unique, this family run diner is a staple breakfast/lunch spot for those looking for a nostalgic and memorable experience. The food is delicious and the service is great. Love this place!

This is the second time I have visited this fantastic cafe, even the space is limited but I like it because it s a cozy place to dine in. The owner is very nice to the customers, they care for the food & keep the restaurant very clean. When I enter the dining area, he ask for the vaccine card & check the ID, which means this cafe keeps the proper procedure. This time I ordered the steak & egg breakfast, the steak is rare which I ordered is perfectly cooked, also with the poach eggs and side hollandaise sauce, very tasty. The white toasts and the hash browns are crispy and they also come with a macaroni salad which is yummy too. Compare to the last time I have a deluxe burger which is fabulous, but my wife said the wonton is so so, (the owner told us that he used the best quality pork that s why made the wonton not tender), I understand not every good things come together will be the best. Overall the quality & the quantity are well balanced, I enjoy the music that they played which is around 50  & 60 , I like their food and also the atmosphere of this small cafe, I will come back for sure.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Andrew, Thanks for taking the time to write your review! We are glad you enjoyed our steak and eggs and our burger! And thanks for the feedback on our wontons! We look forward to your next visit! Much appreciated! Raymond

review_text: When you come in, you re treated like family . This outstanding family operated establishment is located in a old cafeteria built in 1949. 90% of their menu items are made in house. Hand made fries and shredded hash browns. Chinese dumplings. Pancake batter made to order. The friendliness is genuine and the food is made with pride and love. Comfort food for western and Asian gastronome.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Kelvin, Thanks and much appreciated for your review! We are glad you enjoyed your experience! And yes we make 90% of the menu in house and we treat our guest like family! We have lots of menu items for you to try! We look forward to your next visit! Raymond

review_text: Awesome comfort food breakfasts!  Theyre awesome, definitely the best omelette Ive had in months, loaded with veggies and cooked perfectly. Still the best hash browns in the city and a little side of potato salad caps off the entire meal.  Highly recommended!

Cool dinner above lumber yard! The AAA burger, spicy chicken burger and the Philly steak sandwich were what my daughters and I ordered. I got to have a tiny bit of their lunch and have to say I really love my spicy chicken burger as the sauce was mayo with chilly & little pickle bits - very nice. AAA was a nice burger and juicy. Philly I tried just tiny bit of beef was okay for me, but my youngest daughter liked it. The family behind the counter were busy but jovial! Nice cooking, chefs!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Vi, Thank you so much for this amazing review. We truly appreciate it. So happy your family enjoyed the food and experience!! Our burgers are all homemade with the best quality AAA beef - so juicy and succulent. We cannot wait to have you back. Have a great long weekend!!! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Yummy breakfast and a variety of other options. Seems to be a family business. Warm and inviting. Not hipster. You will not be coming here for the decor but for the food and customer service. I love supporting small family businesses!
response_from_owner_text: Hi kawaii, Thanks and much appreciated for sharing your experience and for your support! We are family own and operated and our culture is to treat our guest like family! We hope to see you again! Raymond

review_text: Don t let the outside scare you away.  This is definitely a hole in the wall kind of diner.  The inside is really clean.  The food is pretty decent.  They make their own womtons!  This diner offers western brunch and Chinese food.  Family operated business and super friendly owner. Will definitely return to try the Philly steak and the clubhouse sandwiches.
response_from_owner_text: Hi I F, Thanks for not judging its book by its cover! And yes we are definitely a hole in a wall! We make 90% of our menu all in house! Thanks and much appreciated for sharing your experience and we look forward to your next visit! Raymond

review_text: We woke up extra early before work to try this cozy little diner out and it was totally worth it! The owners greeted us happily upon our arrival and Raymond checked on us a few times during our meal.  Our conversation felt genuine and not forced.  As I told him, I normally cannot finish my entire breakfast, but today, I did! The food is delicious and made with care in mind -- we will definitely be back.  Also, pancakes and hashbrown are a must-get!! :3
response_from_owner_text: Hi Jenn - it was so wonderful to have you visit. Thank you for taking time to write this review and sharing the photos. Truly appreciate it. It was great we can chat a bit and wonderful you enjoyed the food - this means a lot to us.  :) We cannot wait to have you guys back again. For now, take care and stay warm. See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Very friendly service, huge portion of food at good price.

I came here for brunch with my friend and I told her that this hidden Vancouver restaurant is one of the most highly rated restaurants in Canada. The food and service were excellent and the atmosphere was amazing
response_from_owner_text: HI OLOLT, Thank you for leaving an amazing review here. We truly appreciate it. Glad you enjoyed the food and experience! We look forward to serving you again soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Definitely my kind of place to eat, is a little bit different than your typical eatery but is a laid back diner accompanied with diner type vibes kinda like from the 90s movies. Mostly brunch and comfort Chinese food dont expect top of the line. As for the service, You will not find any greater service in Vancouver.

I discovered Northern cafe right before the pandemic in 2019. Ive been a regular ever since! They serve classic breakfast options and also have great asian dishes like their homemade wontons and pot stickers. I recommend their homemade hot sauce when you come. If youre looking for a simple, but flavourful meal where youre treated like family, this is the place to be! Thank you for your warm hospitality everytime when we come. :)
response_from_owner_text: HI Tony Thank you so much for taking the time to write this wonderful review. We truly appreciate it and feel the love/support. Glad you enjoyed the food and experience - and most of all you felt like family here. Also happy to hear you enjoyed our homemade hotsauce. Not sure if you know but we also sell that by the jar so you can enjoy it anytime - its a great compliment to any dishes! We look forward to having you back again. See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Im never gonna get tired of the food in this place!   From the hand pressed beef patty burger, Northern Deluxe to the pot stickers,  its all delicious. My cravings have been calling for the sweet & sour pork lately and this cafe never fails to satisfy. Highly recommended if youre looking for friendly services, upbeat & cozy atmosphere with good vibes and delicious food!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Tia, Thank you for the glowing review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: Wife and I recently visited this place. The reviews are definitely true. The food was really good. We really loved the hash browns there. Service wise, it was top notch. Its on the top of my list if anyone asks for recommendations for a brunch/breakfast place.

This place is probably one of the best hidden breakfast spots in all of Vancouver! Everything was excellent, the poached eggs were perfectly done and the sausage and bacon were fantastic as well. To top it off the owner and master chef includes a small dish of his own homemade egg salad which was phenomenal. Its so cool that this cafe is quite literally hidden in a lumber yard, if you have the opportunity to go you gotta check this place out! It will be my new go to spot when visiting Vancouver. Parking: Approximately 4 spots in front of the cafe and extra street parking just outside the lumber yard.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Aaron, Truly appreciate you taking time to give us a great review and 5-star rating! We humbled by this! Delighted to hear you enjoyed the experience and the food! Yes - Everything on our menu is made from scratch including the egg salad! It s a favourite for many guests! Thank you again and we are looking forward to serving you again! Richard and Raymond

review_text: This is the best out of the way diner in Vancouver!! Ignore the lumberyard as you walk up the narrow stairs, down the commercial hallway, its all worth it. Opening up to a cozy little diner you are immediately taken in with the warmth and home feel of this gem, the service from the start is attentive and warm, the food is easily a match to the service, tasty, not greasy and above all, everything tastes and looks handmade with care. Highly recommend this best kept secret!!!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Brus, Thank you for taking the time to write this amazing review! We are truly humbled and appreciate it! We welcome all guests like family and we are so happy you feel the warmth and enjoyed the food and experience with us. We cannot wait to have you back again soon! Until then, please take care! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Legendary spot with aces of service. The food was excellent. From the location you know they went all in with the food and the service.
response_from_owner_text: Hi P, Thank you for the 5-star review. We truly appreciate it! Feeling the love and support!  Glad you enjoyed the great food and experience.  We look forward to having you back soon!  :) Richard and Raymond

review_text: First time customers  and we now know why this is a hidden  gem. First, place is located within a wooden storage yard. And decor isnt  anything special but really reflects east side! My sons are huge pancake fans, so always hard finding good tasty, fluffy pancakes at an affordable  price. This place has it. I ordered the Blueberry and Chocolate  Chip pancakes. Both were fluffy and moist. Veggie eggs benny and cheese omelett was also good. I ordered the French  Toast and it was OK. Wished the slice of bread used for the French toast was thicker. Pork sausage was nice and plump and bacon cooked just right. Well  definitely be keeping this place on our list of go to places! Well  try dining in next time. Cost for the 5 dishes was $63. Very affordable compared to other breakfast places where Id be looking at closer to $80.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Denny, Thanks for taking the time to write your review! We are glad your son enjoyed our whipped to batter fluffy pancakes! We will definitely look into and try a different bread for our french toast! Thanks for the feedback! We are glad you enjoyed your experience and we look forward to your next visit! Much appreciated! Raymond

review_text: We love this place! The food was amazing. Richard, our server, was so kind and explained how it s a family owned business. I could eat 100 of his mom s pot stickers. It was worth the wait and the hype! For ambiance, it s a classic diner style that s really comforting for breakfast. We will be coming back plenty!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Clinton, Thank you for leaving a glowing review here and on yelp! We truly appreciate it. So happy you guys enjoyed everything here. I will share your comments about the potstickers with my mom.  - this will put a smile on her face. :) Appreciate the support and love! Looking forward to seeing you back soon. Take care and enjoy your weekend! Richard and Raymond

review_text: Heard lots of good things about this place and finally gave it a try. Very pleased with the everything! Probably the best pork potstickers I ve had in a long time. Also loved the ham eggs benny, and the hash browns that came with them were incredible. Hoping to come back soon!
response_from_owner_text: HI Hayley, Thank you for taking the time to visit us a share this glowing review! We truly appreciate it! So happy you enjoyed the food and experience. Our pork potstickers are all made in-house and great to hear you loved it - including our breakfast menu! We look forward to serving you again! See you soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: If I could live next to Northern Cafe just to eat their breakfast every day, I would. Honestly my go to for a wholesome meal. Their pot stickers are so good, and the eggs are always cooked to perfection. The breakfast sausages are my favourite, and I always get an extra side order of it (sometimes a double). Portion sizes are great, so you will always feel full after a meal. The owners are the best. They remember you even if you went only once before! It can get pretty busy, so try going before the rush, otherwise you could be waiting a while. I love eating here so much, my phones lock screen was a photo of their breakfast for 2 years. Its not just about the food, but the overall experience!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Vicky, Thanks and much appreciated for sharing your experience! Glad you enjoyed our homemade potstickers! We treat our guest like family! We hope to see you again!

review_text: Definitely the best home style breakfast I ve ever had at this cafe. The server was very friendly and welcoming, you felt like you were part of the family when you went in. I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Jomar, Thank you for leaving an amazing review here. We truly appreciate it. Glad you enjoyed the food and experience - you are part of the family! :) We look forward to having you back soon! Richard and Raymond

review_text: OK, so I was at Kaltire as I just dropped off my car for the tires to be changed. So I googled where to go for breakfast. I saw Dennys was close but I was hoping for something better. And then I found this restaurant. It had the best reviews and pictures, so I thought wed give it a go. When we arrived we were very confused as it seemed it was inside a lumber yard. But I saw the entrance and we went up. It was so cute and cozy with the big red poofy booth seats. A true diner. Even diner 50s music was playing.
